jxexhtGK85Ijuar-RFgOkQ.text: When we came in we were seated quickly and our order was taken immediately. The waitresses were very sweet and knowledgeable. The food was fresh and hot, and the snow crab legs were worth the price. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends. Oh and the music was on point !

wZsG1TcGIrj4zxZIepeaZA.text: So just to start their shrimp were amazing and the seasonings in general are pretty darn good. The reason I gave 2 and not more is simply because the crawfish were very small and the didn't even have any fresh available. I'm very disappointed because crawfish is in their name and the frozen ones they did have (which came at a cheaper rate $10/pound) were really not good. I had about 30 random claws at the bottom of the bag and the fish were very small. I'd probably just go to a buffet and eat em there next time. But really the shrimp were on point. Thanks!

krEG2gdnhsezVZDWGSo5jg.text: My 10 year old son loved this place and is begging to go again. Great value for the money and a fun experience!

JIJtWnJWMINx-OEZePwMvA.text: So, I can to Vegas for vacation, like many. When I was told there was a crawfish join in town, I knew I had to visit the place. So I was super excited to have some awesome shrimp and crawfish with the amazing seasoning and spice. Let's get started:  The Food Everything was delicious and quite satisfying. A friend and I shared the "Get Your Feet Wet" combo and that was perfect! We also had to order the cajun fries. Cajun fries were okay. I wish they had extra Cajun spice to it. Also, I like my Cajun fries with ketchup mayo and they were accommodating with no charge; where other places have charged me for that request.   The Service The servers were pretty normal. Nothing too exciting. My colleagues had stated they wish the server would check in with us more often.   Overall, if you craving some crawfish...here is the place to go.

SbHsRBwg8jDWwYCZIDMCdQ.text: Hot N juicy, Las Vegas Strip.  Restaurant or club? The new location serves up good food but thinks it's a hip hop club on the strip. What a way to ruin the good reputation this restaurants other two locations have built up. We had shrimp, crab and catfish. Nothing to complain about with the food.  The service was good.  I asked the server if they could turn the music down and they did but it fluctuated thereafter. Not a pleasing environment to enjoy dinner. The rapping hip hop, stole the show. It's not even a pleasant R & B but straight up hip hop. Now I know why they were not close to full on a Saturday night with no wait.  The food remains good but unless you want to eat at a hip hop /restaurant club stay away from this Las Vegas strip location and hit the original. If that's your thing, by all means, be sure to visit. If you have a family avoid this location at all cost. This location may want to try an island or top 40 vibe as that music may be more appropriate and more family friendly.. Just something more soothing. I spoke with our server later and they agreed but the owners obviously think this club environment is the way to go. I noticed the servers were having a hard time hearing as much as the customers. Club or Restaurant? What does Hot N Juicy want to be? We chose the wrong location this time. It want happen again. Very disappointing especially for the price.

Ltf12fl9y9uhNDpBEfMx4Q.text: The hubby and I went here last night it was our first time here so we was very excited.... everything was great we was sooo full when we left .... we got (8) wings which were tiny but soooo good only comes plain though with a side of ranch for $11 ... one pound of crabs ($23) ... two pounds of shrimp ... side of rice ($3)  ... Hawaiian rolls u get 3 for ($2) .... we order dozen sausages ($6) .... and it was (0.75) for every corn and potatoe you order !!!   We wanted oysters but they only came raw && we like it steam lol we ordered some to try it out a dozen was ($24) but we just couldn't eat it lol   We had got the hot n juicy flavor with extra spicy &&& I love it it was sooo spicy and good you definitely needed water lol   Ashley was great she really made our experience enjoyable.... we will be coming backkkk

jn038vmTiZU2SUGhgg5fQQ.text: Best crawfish in all of LA, and definitely a top spot in the U.S. Hot N Juicy is infamous for being featured on food network tv shows and raved my celebrities, so I am lucky to have had the luxury of dining here, enjoying my favorite meal at one of the best speciality restaurants to offer. I ordered a few pounds of crawfish in their special garlic butter based sauce, as well clams, and blue crabs. Everything was delightful and we all enjoyed our seafood. Hot N Juicy was so good, I went every day that I was visiting Las Vegas & I purchased a T-Shirt that I adored. Definitely come here for great seafood and the warm friendly customer service.  P.S they will only seat you if your full party is there, which I don't mind since I am in the restaurant industry and it's totally understandable seeing that they often have a waitlist.

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AfWtc6pSy2Zas69hh5TnDA.text: Had such a great experience for my first time at Hot N Juicy. I was so indecisive on what I wanted and JR suggested great items on the menu. Everything came out super quick and the service was just overall great. I'll definitely be back soon!

El5E2eITHvE12UxpgCk1iQ.text: Here is the short and sweet, or rather I mean bitter because, food was good, but service was lacking. Sat there and waited after ordering for about an hour before our pounds of shrimp arrived, noticed other customers seated after us already recieving there orders, long before asking about our orders which promptly came after we had asked. And didn't even receive any apologies or explanation about the delay. Waiting that long for food makes you lose your appetite and leave a bad taste. Love hot and juicy, but will not be coming back to this location.

Ai4Q7pfUakKkewq4-u3SFg.text: Only in Vegas can you have the best hot n juicy! The only downfall is I can't see the heads on my shrimp! (Don't judge me) lol but every now and than I get a kind waitress willing to cut them off for me. Other times not so much! Lol

G-W_pOdYrdDrl6eX3nRWtg.text: Man I sat in the restaurant enjoyed a meal, placed a order Togo and tipped my waitress 25%. Setting me back $125. So I place a order togo, I pay my tab and walk out the door a few min later. I call back to see if I can get my food, THEY TELL ME THERES NOTHING THEY CAN DO AND I CANT GET MY MONEY BACK.

UzYuj_ajKeSzrKMbnEVhAw.text: Finally we don't have to drive off strip anymore for our mandatory meal at Hot N Juicy. Loved the crawfish and snow crab once again and it's low carb / keto!! We went with mild (which felt like medium) and medium (that felt like hot) with Hot N Juicy seasoning. We had 2lbs of crawfish and 1lb of crab which was reasonable. Didn't have to wait for a table. Service was a little slow towards the end to get the check and pay but otherwise no complaints. Thanks for opening a location by the strip. We'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath!

FBUg_fsu7ozdtfI16wYEmg.text: Ever since I saw Hot N Juicy on Man V Food I knew I had to come here one day. I've finally got my chance to try it and it has met and exceeded my expectations. I got two lbs of crawfish, a lb of shrimp, a lb of king crab, and some corn fritters and let me just say it was all FIREEEEE. The extra spicy Hot N Juicy sauce amplified the flavors of the shellfish and the corn and potatoes that came with the crawfish. The waitress warned me that it might be too spicy but it was just fine for me. The corn fritters though.. biting in to these was like fireworks in your mouth! A definite must get if you come here!  I will definitely be back here again one day!

943o2WFbuRPnxMjljlxnPQ.text: This place is on the side of the building, not very obvious. They have a big place and prepare food fastly. The seafood is so juicy and delicious!

sNh09shahxTvKZ1S2c-djw.text: Food was good, but not the best crawfish we have had.  Some of us ordered with the Hot N Juicy sauce, which some of my friends thought it was too salty; I didn't mind it too much.  I ordered a pound of crawfish and a pound of clams in the Hot N Juicy sauce extra spicy just for myself.  I didn't think it was spicy at all, and most other places I've been to, when I get it spicy, it actually burns my lips.  And they put my crawfish and clams in separate bags, which was fine.  But the clams were 95% empty shells because most of the clam meat had fallen out and I had to dip my fingers in the sauce to look for them.  It didn't feel like there was enough clam meat hiding in the sauce to match the number of empty shells.  We still enjoyed our dinner and left full.

cMpq9ITN-FoqCAcHIZvupA.text: So for starters finding this location is complicated as hell. Its literally on the strip, you have to park at a near by casino and walk there, which is costly parking in the parking garages. It was not busy at all for a Friday, which was dope. We're seated quickly order and drinks are taken at a timely manner which is great, thank you slim white girl w the glasses. But when our food came out it was cold :( Also it was not seasoned entirely, like there was a normal amount of sauce but not mixed around with the seafood.. ?  It was not hot in temperature at all like it usually is at other hot n juicy locations. I tasted the green mussels or black cant remember, but they tasted so disgusting like dirty seafood. UGH so gross man, usually when i order those they taste like the hot n juicy sauce... Weird overall food was disappointing , not what it usually is at the spring mtn locations.. Total waste of money. Employees are great nice and friendly. Food was not fresh enough.

AlrM08FT7UZWUs7xtVfdnQ.text: This restaurant is right off the strip and is a must do! It was clean and modern. Service was good. But the food!!! We had a mix of shrimp, crawfish, sausage, corn, potatoes and crab legs that was serve in a large plastic bag and without utensils. We also had calamari. It was plenty(or just enough because we were sooo hungry) for me and my husband. The shrimp were pretty big! The broth was amazing! I had to ask for Hawaiian rolls to soak it up! Make sure you wear the bib becauae it's totally hands on!! If you come to Las Vegas you must come here!

0iqnXGqFQXkmcoEywa6J3g.text: THIS RESTAURANT WAS HORRIBLE! ALL of the servers including the manager was absolutely rude!  I was starting to wonder if it is because I am a person of color. I had to watch the person I was with slowly & awkwardly eat their food. I literally had to wait 20 min after my friend had her meal before I inquired about what was going on with my meal.   The waitress did not look concerned and came back 10 min later to say that it was "on its way."   By the time the food finally came out my friend d was absolutely finished with her meal and I had to cancel my order. I would NOT RECOMMEND!

VceuZXBEj-l-C3Eq7PMatQ.text: Excited to see there's a location right by the strip. I usually had to hop a ride to visit, but now can walk. This place sits on the side street by Planet Hollywood.  True to HnJ style, the food was great. I went with the crab legs with medium garlic butter flavor, a corn, a potato and a side of rolls. The medium was a little spicier than I remembered, but still very good. One of my friends went with the shrimp, mild and my other friend has a shrimp and crab combo spicy. We were all satisfied with our meals and service was friendly and very prompt. Definitely worth a visit.

qrxp16PhY7mqzoTq6kTisA.text: Reasonable price, highly recommend Hot N juicy source! Wild is spicer than I expected. We three person order one $36 experience, 1 lb lobster and one basket of soft shell. Suitable amount!

Jcce0yroPuSxCnegkyWkDA.text: The atmosphere was nice enough, but this was a great example of style over substance.  I came here around 3pm on a Saturday with my family hoping to get my fix of raw oysters that I miss so much after moving to the southwest but was sadly disappointed. I know it's the strip, half a dozen was $13, I wouldn't complain about that at all were they not literally all smaller than a Starburst candy. I knew I should have called Uber and gone somewhere that wasn't touristy (i.e. not the strip) but we were hungry. On top of this the service was horrible, it wasn't busy and I'd say it was even overstaffed, yet every dish for the four of us came out at extremely different times, Oysters and a Calamari app first, one po'boy for my brother 10 minutes later, chicken nuggets for my Mother another 10 minutes later, and 30 minutes later another po'boy for our friend. He got tired of waiting and asked to cancel it so we could leave since we'd nearly finished but was told it'd be out in two minutes (it wasn't).  The really annoying part was the manager coming over and explaining in a patronising way that fried food cooks differently than non-fried food, and no we didn't mishear her say they cook at different rates, nothing on our table wasn't fried aside from the earlier oysters. We pointed this out and that despite coming in long after us the table next to us was served first, it was also all fried and served at very odd times. The "spicy" Cajun sandwiches and calamari were bland but at least edible, the oysters were fine but *ridiculously* small, the chicken was awful however.  Maybe it was a bad day, but I'd never go back nor recommend it to anyone.

NmwTMQZSCxU1Vyd5xvtILg.text: This place was everything!! From service to food it was great! I love the set up of the restaurant the wait staff was friendly and the tunes were popping. The catfish is amazing and those crab legs were so Devine! I got the spicy hot and juicy flavors for the crab legs.

hKH81TOwBDVxKWsttD3MPw.text: Always a big fan of this place.  I've been at their location in DC as well.   Good food, good service, reasonable prices....  except the crabs...   to expensive for what you get, you are better off ordering an extra pound of shrimp or clams.

Bvmjhack_PON3LEgVrf-bA.text: Had the crawfish po boy.  There was not much crawfish on the sandwich and what was there was mostly fried batter.  My friend and I got the same dish and both got sick later that day.  Would never go back unless it's just for fresh shrimp or fresh crawfish as others seemed to enjoy these.

o3yK4BijMuSzFj3oDBgOGg.text: Greatest seafood ever I absolutely love it,I have to have it every time I'm in Las Vegas even if it's Father's Day.

HEKXhhToXGjQ0dMOzuyKIA.text: Our waiter spark was very attentive he listened to our order got everything right! Overall experience the food is hands down the best. I'm from Orange County so all I have is boiling crab or kickin crab. I wish I could have a hot n juicy close by :(

5-Czca5Yyj16AEStLUBlRQ.text: I loved the environment! The wait was a bit long but the service was amazing. The servers were super lazy though, there was one woman doing everything!

3b-egjAIXAuFglU2NpZbhA.text: Hot N Juicy shrimp with corn was delish! Saw them on Man vs Food so I made sure to try them next time I'm in Vegas. Did not disappoint me! Awesome service, friendly staff, and yummy food!

HqKMGdWiVs_0glsWp86hBg.text: What an amazing app experience.  A unique and tasty find so close to everything.  Love spicy and love seafood and this delivered.  The hardest working waitress in Las Vegas, Micah, was attentive and helpful with out order.  The crab spices were perfect.  I got to wear gloves and I never wear gloves.  Gonna dream about my return.  Stop questioning.  Just go!

And i asked the waiter if she could move us to another table because becuase the sunlight was hitting our table. She said no. I let that slide. So the whole time she wouldn't check up on us. I never got the refills i asked for in 2 of our drinks. Our waiters name was Rizzan. I'm not going to this location again.

lP-i2WpFlVY6utjGdCxDhg.text: I have eaten at HNJ in Los Angeles and in their various Virginia locations and this location was the worst. I literally got half the amount of mussels in the pound that I ordered. Based on my previous experience in any other locations and I eat and order the same thing at HNJ in LA every week. So beware.... I literally had to walk two storefronts down to Buffalo Wild Wings and order wings since I was still hungry when normally After I eat a couple pounds of mussels I am full and no I was not extremely hungry or drunk.....just saying! Avoid this location and go somewhere else on the strip.

kqsRBHcO_jg02D3sDqhcQw.text: The food was amazing.   The staff was awesome as well. The atmosphere was welcoming.  Will definitely be back.  I can taste the Cajun Calamari now! Yum

Ho4iJFmLjV8I4mprodT72g.text: Flavorful shrimp, crab, corn, and sausage swimming in Hot n Juicy, garlic, spicy sauce. Coke and rice balanced it all out and we had the sweetest waitress. Josh just sat us down and gave us drink but did even bother to come ask us if we need anything until the very end when we done eating he didn't even gave us any glove or bibs like any other customer, we usually tip $20 or more when they service is good and we are happy to give big tips but not if you don't want to service us. Sometimes it's all about the food quality but the food service counts too. You can't enjoy your food when you don't get food service.

PaLUS_q9qTr-b-bSA8GNfA.text: This place is Absolutely amazing!!!! Service is great I just wish the had alcohol and more locations in Las Vegas.

HEnlFPdJUku7IkeBa6Mpzg.text: Awesome food. Absolutely delicious. We had shrimp, lobster, mussels, crab legs and crawfish (which I personally feel are a waste of time and energy to eat) but bottom line this place is great. We actually loved the  butter and garlic sauce which is not typical butter and garlic. All the sauces have a Cajun prep to them. But it had more flavor than their hot n juicy sauce. Go and try. If you love seafood and don't mind heads on shrimp...you'll love this place.

rjxxHYL4bNmrW0XEENXdHg.text: This place is small but so good I loved every minute. U have to go here when ur in Vegas

PFPuiw8t7ADV0aTRQaGRgw.text: I would think since this location sits outside planet Hollywood and gets a lot of foot traffic they would be more attentive and friendly. The front hostesses are slightly rude like they just can't be nice. The servers aren't as attentive nor responsive like you would think. I always order my sauce on the side and it's never been an issue. I get my food and it's not on the side so i let the server know. A couple mins go by and they bring back my crab legs only to have rinsed off the sauce. So instead of bringing steamed crab that had no sauce on them i get rinsed off crab legs oh ok. IimqlrAryDc546ELEzV3lA.text: Very unprofessional. The gal in the front pick and chooses who she wanted in the restaurant . She said we needed a t shirt and we CLEARLY all had a cover top . But yet a gal in the booth had a swim suit top and said she "had a crop top" and the gal in the booth ADMITTED she had NO problem when was sitting With her bikini top . The receptionist also grabbed my phone because she knew she was wrong . I hope the regional manager sees this . Because what she did was NOT right . We all know it's Las Vegas and it's 104 degrees . Do she want me to have a sweater on or what ? Please have an explanation for me managers . No excuses for this .

EJAaywoq2d8qAf6LRycuXQ.text: This is located past the stairs and elevators next to taco bell cantina. We had a hard time finding it. The place was packed when we got there at 9pm, so it seemed promising. We were told there would be a 25 minute wait for the two of us, but we got seated within 5 minutes, so that was very nice! After being seated, we got our menus and it took a little while before we ordered. I got a pound of crawfish hot n juicy, extra spicy with 3 potatoes and cajun fries. The crawfish was okay, I didn't love the sauce like I do with The Boiling Crab or any of the other chains in SoCal. It wasn't as garlicky or robust in flavor as I like it. Extra spicy maybe could pass for a medium at other places, so that was a little disappointing too. They charge $0.75/potato. Lastly, I can't believe how salty the cajun fries were. I ended up not finishing them, because they didn't have much flavor but saltiness. Hardly any cajun spice. Overall, I was excited to see such high ratings for this place, but my experience was a letdown. At these prices, I expected higher quality food. The servers did seat us quickly and checked up on us frequently, but it took a little while to get our order in. 3/5 stars.

JK00cd_iK53faIeiV4pDeg.text: This hot n juicy is the best Cajun boil I have ever had. For some reason, this location is better than the others off the strip. The service is quick, we never have to wait when we go. Our favorite flavors Are the Hot N Juicy and the Garlic Butter. Their oysters are always fresh. Cajun fries are on point. Typically we get clams in Garlic Butter; and crawfish, snow crab legs, and shrimp in the Hot N Juicy. Their spice level is pretty on point. Medium does have a kick to it. I've had a friend order extra extra spicy (he pops ghost peppers like nothing) and that was definitely on his level.  If you're a fan of Cajun boil, do not pass up a chance to try this place. It's conveniently located on the strip right outside of the miracle mile shops next to planet Hollywood.

dphQyVWyfj02ErE_CBq5MA.text: Hot, Juicy and you will be working for your food at this place. Hahaha!   What a cool experience at Hot N Juicy Crawfish.  I have to say that I did have a good time once I got the hang of this place.    If you're a Booshie Chic like me, be ready to get down and dirty and work for your food.  Luckily, I was with a bunch guy friends and colleagues who were more than happy to help me crack my crab legs and peel my shrimp.    I'm not a crawfish lover but I love Crab.  The Crab Legs were yummy delicious.   The food all comes out in a plastic bag all steamed, hot and spicy.   The appetizers were yummy too.   Now this place only serves Beer and sodas.  No alcohol and no wine. So that's one less Star.  Other than that everything was great.  After getting the hang of it, I finally was able to fill my belly and keep up with the guys.   Ambiance is nice and the staff was very helpful and accommodating.    Forks up on Hot N Juicy.  I'll be back this summer!

VIAfLzoqlfm_aGrHs8kICw.text: This location is just like all of the other locations of Hot n Juicy and it has great service.  I'm no stranger to this restaurant chain but it was my first trip to this location. It's tucked away on the side of Planet Hollywood Casino so you don't have to travel far from your resort. We went on a Friday night in the summer and there was no wait at all to get in.  It's a simple concept for a restaurant but so delicious! I love spicy food but you don't have to get it spicy if you can't handle the heat. I've tried different things over the years including shrimp, mussels, crab, and crawfish. This time I had the green mussels, hot and juicy seasoning, medium spice level.  They tend to go heavy on the seasoning so beware when you order that if you get medium it will be pretty spicy.  I've gotten sides of rice, fries, and bread. I love dipping the fries in the left over sauce in my bag. Yum yum.  Be prepared to get messy! They give you a bib and plastic gloves to wear if needed. (I highly recommend it) Check this place out! The two locations on Spring Mountain are great as well!

f72akwBpHO3m7dZcCYEcxA.text: I love eating here! Wait time might be a little longer just cos it's on the strip. I always get lemon pepper shrimp and it's so good. Jennifer was our server and she was super friendly and attentive to our table! Always made sure our waters were filled and that we got all of our food. We had a bigger group and she was able to split our checks with no problem

-ByQi6c8DvUXZtLaC6XZLg.text: I was reluctant to go to this restaurant since I'm not a huge fan of crawfish but at my son's urging we decided go. The atmosphere is very casual and the first thing i noticed was people eating with plastic bibs on.  At a closer look, the tables were covered in plastic and the ordered food all came in plastic bags.  No bowls or plates.  We ordered crawfish, shrimp, and snow crabs with the hot and juicy sauce at the lowest spice level since we had you kids. We ordered spicy sauce on the side for the adults.  Once the order came, we had a fun experience pulling the food out of plastic bags and piling the shells on our table.  The kids enjoyed eating with their hands and we all loved what reminded me of Cajun flavor. I preferred the shrimp and the snow crab over the crawfish mainly because of the amount of return for the work of peeling was better than the crawfish.   I also want to leave a little shout out to the our server. She was great in showing us how to peel the crawfish and bringing us extra plastic gloves, paper towels, etc.

wF15IrtAvJ8uGn7Af_C8jA.text: Seated us fairly quickly considering it was busy and the host said 40 min. It was more like 7. We ordered the snow crab, shrimp and oysters.  The snow crab didn't seem like 1 pound. The hot n juicy sauce was tasty. I wasn't too big a fan of the oysters.

nXnGg8E20B3KhwVi3REs1Q.text: Our last two trips to Vegas included at least one dinner here. We usually come to celebrate birthday's so have a larger group than most. The food is always good. My usual go-to is the crawfish or shrimp in the spicy hot n juicy sauce with potatoes, corn and a side of rice. We tried the garlic butter sauce this time and it was good as well. My husband doesn't like to peel anything so he goes for their crawfish poboy which isn't bad either (could use more crawfish though). This last time we were there it started off great, the server took all our orders and started bringing out the drinks.  Shortly after drinks came out he was moved to another section and everything went down the drain. Our order got so messed up - drinks never came out, food was wrong etc. The servers that were helping us had attitude and any time we pointed out what was still missing their looked annoyed with us. At the very beginning of our meal someone ordered a coke but didn't get it until after he was done eating despite us reminding them twice about it. One of the meals we ordered came so late we ended up taking it to go because we already delayed with our evening plans due to all the mix up. Good food, but it will probably be a better experience with a small group. No pictures because everyone was busy eating and hands were good and dirty...lol.

xqehBo-KfFsMn-6GgicwlQ.text: This place is so good we went two days in a row. It was crawfish season and you can tell they were fresh. The food comes out really quick. What keeps this place from being a 5 star is the service seems disorganized. Which ever waiter/ress is free will seat you vs. having a host and the set up is its difficult to see the front of the restaurant. The staff also doesn't check on you often so be ready to waive em down. The second attempt was better service.  But the food alone is a definitely repeat. I'd gone a 3rd day but we had to leave town.

aE0LxMsbM7yqe2MGAHTD-A.text: Just picked up our order of 2lbs snow crab legs and 1lb shrimp Louisiana style "mild" and 1lb shrimp garlic butter "mild" to go. The waitress that helped me out was very helpful and nice.   Got home all excited but we CANNOT eat any of it! None of it. Everything was too spicy. My wife loves spicy seafood, took one (1) bite and her face turned red right away. Again, we ordered "mild" so we just couldn't believe how spicy everything was. I understand the name of the restaurant is Hot n Juicy but this is just insane.   Called them up to see what can be done since we had just paid close to $85. They said that they "cannot control the batch of peppers they get" and it can get really spicy. I was also advised to cook our food up again in butter. So our parents are currently recooking the meal that we paid for. Feeling very frustrated.   I'm not sure if it would've been different if we ate in the restaurant and if this is the norm for their "mild" spiciness. If it is, I'm not sure why they even have that as an option and please be warned that it is VERY HOT!

wtkfQrtrvN3d48Cj8IS_mg.text: In my to go order, (2 lbs clam, 2lbs shrimp and 2 lbs crawfish). I found two stones(6 oz almost) in the clam bag. Crawfish is not fresh at all. Shrimp is not bad. I ate hot n juicy many times in different city. This time is not a good experience.

F2EZwnnThXGaET4h3jnuJA.text: More For Less!!!  If you are a local and have visited the other locations in Las Vegas, you'll know what I mean. If you are a visitor with a car or transportation... it may be best for you to go to either of the other locations to get the TRUE Hot N Juicy experience.   Coming to the new location, we expected the experience to be better than, or at least similar to the other locations.   However, the prices were a little more at this location, but that wasn't the problem. EVERYTHING they brought to the table contained next to NO sauce. We were treating my niece for her birthday and she ordered The Experience which came with a butt load of items... and it too had almost NO SAUCE! So, we had to order extra sauce for each order. Finally, my sister ordered a pound of snow crab and it come with only 5 legs.   We spoke to the host to inquire about the increase in prices and to address the lack of sauce and the missing crab legs. His only justification was, "Well, this is The Strip." We were not satisfied with his explanation. So, he said he'd speak to the lead server. Unfortunately,  he came back to say his lead server said there was NOTHING they could do. So, we asked for the Manager. His response was, "Well, the Manager is a little too busy right now." We told him we'd wait!   Eventually,  the manager come to the table and he agreed that there was no way that those 5 pieces amounted to 1 pound and that each bag should have contained more sauce. So, he offered to compensate by taking the extra sauces off the bill and to prepare the other half of the missing crab legs (it took FOREVER to come out though).   In the end... we paid our $160, and we will NOT be coming back or making recommendations for this location.

LO3QHKmQULT2riqkfx6bWg.text: Love eating here and have never been disappointed. I usually get the snow crab legs hot and juicy baby spice cuz my boyfriend can't handle the heat and shrimp in garlic butter. Love it!

I6e7mwtiiq4C4B5cu2-B-g.text: #ProTip: the Las Vegas locations do not offer *only* garlic butter - you must also choose a spice level.  I'd called ahead to alert them of our large group of 18, and although they don't accept reservations, we only had to wait about 15 minutes for tables to be ready to accommodate our large group. We ended up at two long tables, with one table sharing assorted pounds of very spicy seafood, and the other table ordering mostly on our own. Our server was excellent, and no one had to wait for their next beverage.  Having dined at the Orlando location several times, I knew I liked Baby Spice, as I find it less intense than just garlic butter (which is an option by itself in Orlando), and I chose snow crabs on this visit. As I'd hoped, my crab legs were large & tasty! And, as expected, very MESSY! So unfortunately, I have no photos... because you know I had to keep my phone safe.  This Hot N Juicy is on two levels, so seating seems plentiful. And this location is very central on the Strip, just outside of Planet Hollywood. So while its a cheap Lyft from nearly any of the big resorts, some of our group enjoyed walking back to Luxor that night.

3bjVhUGi0mfOIQG_B9AtyQ.text: First off let me say don't come to Vegas and miss out eating here!!  However, I walked into this location expecting it to be perfect like my home location that I visit every week in Orlando and it was not. First off the welcome was dismal. In Orlando they yell welcome to hot n juicy and I like the excitement. The service was good but not super friendly bc no one asked us how we were or why we were there which was to celebrate my sisters birthday.. taking a moment to be personal is what makes experiences special. The Orlando location always welcomes us like we are special. Now the food was on point!! Super delicious seafood and so fresh... nothing but the highest quality seafood. They only use fresh never frozen seafood and you can absolutely taste the difference. We had crabs, crawfish, green mussels, shrimp, oysters, fried chicken...pretty much everything. Hot and Juicy Vegas continues lives up to the name. The only food item I didn't care for was the sausage bc it was a little too spicy for me. I order my seafood in Hot and Juicy sauce - baby spice temperature level. Follow me on ig @sweet_maloy. Bottom line is I would definitely return and eat everything!

AJYHVbRIZhf8LAZuZimnAA.text: As a Hot N Juicy veteran, it's important to note the first thing you need to know, and that's your spice level. Hot N Juicy offers fried items including shrimp, calamari, catfish, etc. Hot N Juicy shines when you decide to get half of pound/a pound of shrimp, crawfish, crab, potatoes, sausage, corn, etc., this is where the spice level come in. You can get your food seasoned a certain (Hot N Juicy) is the best way to go, then you choose your spice level. Be cautious on what you get, baby spice had a minor kick, the intensity of spice leaps as you make the hard decision on what to choose, so be smart. Hot N Juicy makes you dip your food back into the seasoning for better flavor. The snow crab is amazing, and rarely requires the cracking utensil.   The ambience was great. The venue played Hip Hop the whole time I was there so enjoyed a great meal with music I enjoy.

7FtByoq7p8Owhgd3Cv4aMg.text: My first time eating at this chain. It wss a little pricy but delicious. I love seafood and I have to find it wherever I go. I would definitely eat here again.

WtZnp8aAN43eqddaFORa-A.text: My family and I loved this place. When I say the flavors are extreme, they are the best. I had the one pound of shrimp, only $16, good price, we had the catfish poboy, my husband had the Get Your Feet Wet, which comes with shrimp, crawfish, sausage, corn and potatoes with the hot and juicy seasoning. They only reason for the 4 star rating is that the crawfish were very small and frozen, but to be fair, the waiter told us this before we ordered. The shrimp were absolutely delicious and the sandwich bread was soooooo fresh!! I will make this a constant for dinner every single time we are in Vegas..

fwdx7flkfGSPxd0wE6Fqyg.text: Great food w/ good service. There are several restaurants that are similar to this place, but I chose Hot N Juicy based on their menu. They had a few items that some of the similar places didn't offer and I was not disappointed.   We were able to get seated pretty quickly and our waitress was there as soon as we sat down. The food came out good and hot and it didn't take long to get it to our table once we ordered. Everything we ordered came out hot and delicious.   If you're wondering between Hot N Juicy and the other places, pick Hot N Juicy. You'll be glad that you did.

F-D2ZCATxR8d2gTys1ZUFA.text: The fiancee and I are in town for a business/vacay and she found this place in her search for nearby eats. We were surprised at finding a boiled seafood joint so far from the Gulf, so curiosity plus all these good reviews made us venture in. Having lived in Louisiana for many years, I'm often skeptical of boiled crawfish even in Houston, because I've been to so many places that Houstonians consider to have great crawfish, and walked out disappointed at the least or even disgusted. So coming in here, I honestly almost just took the safe road and ordered a fried platter. But instead I went with the Vegas vibe and "rolled the dice." I ordered both crawfish and shrimp--one with Louisiana flavor and the other with Juicy Cajun--both medium spice. I initially asked for spicy but the waitress cautioned that people should order one level down from what they think they want. The fiancee ordered snow crab legs, mild, with Hot N Juicy flavor.   We were both pleased with the flavors. She especially liked the Louisiana on my shrimp, as so many places in Houston label their flavor something LA related, then deliver a gunky mess nothing like the "coon asses" eat. I wished I had stuck with spicy because medium was not as spicy as I like.   Overall, Hot N Juicy did their thang! This was good eating!

A9T0yR-8qugh4mEkOX2GEg.text: I didn't realize this was part of a restaurant group until I read some of the other reviews here. We were looking for a new, fun, food experience, and that's what we got. We usually sit at the bar in restaurants, but, because we were going to eat "something boiled," we were told we needed to sit at a table. I assume there's just not enough room at the bar for everything you'll need: paper towels (lots of them), gloves, bibs, etc.  We ordered a pound of crawfish with garlic butter seasoning and mild spice. Our waiter advised us that the crawfish is frozen, which mildly disappointed us, but we were already so excited it didn't seem to matter much.  It was delicious, but VERY messy. The crawfish was brought out in a plastic bag, which I think was probably the same bag in which they were frozen.  We will probably be back, but this time, we'll know what to expect!

mWURpamKRYwWOXCP47rJ2w.text: Love that they added this location to the strip so we don't have to uber to Chinatown. The thing i like about this chain is how consistent it is.   There's a good variety of seafood, apps,etc. I ordered a half pound of shrimp ($10), pound of snow crab ($23) and corn fritters ($8). I always get the seafood in mild, garlic butter. It's delicious but still spicy in my opinion. I couldn't feel my lips at the end.   Service is attentive and you get the food quick. Perhaps the seafood is a little pricy but good.

vgim7sw_-e_hBUE_NlX-WA.text: I typically rave about this place but after this last encounter I would have to change my mind. I came in with 2 other girlfriends. We had swimwear underneath our clothes but I was wearing shorts and a woven coverup. Literally, covered! But got denied. The day before I knew someone who also got denied. And also a group of girls after me as well. They're reasoning is: we're a family owned business. I'm confused. But this is Vegas strip. Hm. Strange. So be forewarned, they are strict on their clothing policy.   Anyhow, they did let us order it to go anyways. $14/lb... so I ordered 4 lbs, Cajun fries, and wings. Came out to be about $75. So we had to bring it back to our hotel to eat. Imagine how our room smelt after ... lol extremely garlicky. Overall, if you want crawfish, yes come here but maybe not because they'll have a ton of rules and not customer friendly. It's 100+ degree weather, but wear a sweater and jeans to come here apparently.

_Mp1TL3z8fjw02e782QXzg.text: Second time eating here...DELICIOUS! The Drool fed 3 aults with plenty to spare! Spicy calamari...amazing! Try it. you wont be sorry!

fi8RgDhtKPIlzy6yJZgy3Q.text: I like this one . They have good food but the wait time sucks. I was here 45mins before they took my order! But the food was all so delicious. I'll come back for round 2 .

d6lSvKMmvwEFA2f0U62HnQ.text: WOW! We can't get crawfish like this anywhere except Louisiana. And WOW! The food was amazing . Drinks were so good. They accommodated allergies very well for us. Thanks for the great food and great service!

0zxJwtPGHvfP42_qdIoBOg.text: I highly recommend this place if you're in town.  **HnJ  is located outside of the Planet Hollywood along Harmon.**  The atmosphere of this restaurant is nice and extremely clean.  There are sinks outside of the restrooms for your convenience.  And yes, there are sinks inside the restroom as well.  Food and hospitality was great!  The workers are friendly, and easy to approach.  My waiter, Nani, did an exceptional job; friendly and attentive!  I didn't have to ask for a refill on my water, and she constantly made sure my group of friends, as well the other tables she took care of, were doing well.  I'll probably be going to this location instead of the other ones.  I would usually have to beg for service at the other locations.

YI8e4KO_RnyLeTvodYRvZA.text: Loved it! It's a little tight, bit I really appreciate the plastic gloves they provide to eat. The flavor is excellent and the staff was very attentive. We ended up coming here 2x within the week during our trip. I think I might go there each time I'm in town! There is also a bar and upstairs level.

aqE-uwnln6HryIJRJtmjeg.text: Never disappoint. The food was good and the service was great. "The Drool" was everything we were looking for and left our stomach full of satisfaction. The very spicy didn't light our mouths with fire but definitely had a flavorful kick. The servers gave just the right amount of attention where they kept our drinks filled, asked if we needed anything else, and gave us space to enjoy our delicious mess. After finishing off the last shrimp, we were able to use the additional wash station outside the restroom to clean ourselves up. We walked out with an ocean full of seafood in our bellies, which we carried throughout our exploration of the Miracle Mile right next door.

f3JRLs5tcZ95SyUAeU1Dtw.text: Don't waste your time..crawfish charged by the pound and the crawfish missing heads. Smh!!

inA08qg6qLHhQRbOVsC2RA.text: I had a great dinner experience here at hot n juicy . CEASER was my server and he was so sweet and kind very welcoming I'm definitely coming back and asking for ceaser ! Thanks hot n juicy

mDY0bvAOKRbGze_ggpa6UQ.text: The best server I ever had, Lemonade , she was very nice and taking a good care of us. First we sat down we didnt have to wait for that long after we got seated. She just came to us and asked if she could get anything beside water. Here she just made our day already

EwoQ19Oe6V_KO1_IJv1GDA.text: Food was good. Service was slow but good. Shared a shrimp po boy with a friend and the fried calamari. Super spicy and good.

ANlvR4yvsDicX-XTwWI69g.text: This is one of my new go to restaurants in Vegas now! Great food, great atmosphere, and great location! My hubby and I went here on date night because of a yelp review!!!! Glad we listened!!  it here!

mVozDOsWuTAwYOtQruyfCw.text: We ordered 1lb clams, 1lb crawfish,  1lb snow crabs and not a drop left. They were seasoned with their "everything "spice and that was out of the park delicious. Wish they cooked the potatoes a little more and possibly serve garlic bread but other than that this place is a must go to.

UskzTDC0cqA-7MqRHyBhXg.text: Good service and great food. We had the oysters, catfish w/Cajun fries and of course the shrimp (hot & juicy)all were good. A nice addition to the strip will definitely make this one of my go to spot when in Vegas.

cTcGDw58QcfXHNkNa0DpPQ.text: Omg I freaking love hot n juicy!! I had 2 pounds of snow crab one garlic butter with baby spice and the hot n juicy flavor with mild spice to freaking die for!!! Ate here twice while in Vegas!! Definitely will be back again!!!! Staff was pretty cool too!

7EBNcJvWd8Ep3N62f6VCWA.text: Food was delicious and unlike the other locations, when I've gone,  there was no wait at all. I got the medium hot n juicy on my snow crab and crawfish. It still had a lot of heat to it but the flavor was delicious! Service was prompt and friendly....I will definitely return to this location next time we're in Vegas!

UjsZgOi88AqLjIM7K5Xvlw.text: Flavor on point!! Went on a Saturday afternoon. Ordered the get your feet wet and the drool with hot n juicy seasoning. Spice level medium. If you can't take spicy well I suggest getting mild. Service was really good. If you're in the mood for some spicy seafood this is the place to go. Next time I'm in town definily coming back here.

UNPjzkyJB9nfnC2ZehwrUg.text: Visited this place on 8/6/17 while visiting Las Vegas.  The staff was Ok.  I had a party of 5. We ordered drinks first, then we ordered 3 bags of seafood and two po- boys.  The only issues I had with this place is that it was unorganized as far as when they brought the food out.  They brought out our bag of crawfish first, then 15 minutes later brought out one bag of shrimp, 20 minutes later they brought out another bag of shrimp.  They brought out one po boy sandwich and brought out the other po boy sandwich 20 minutes later..... This is unacceptable.  An organized restaurant knows how to bring everything out at one time, or at least within a 5 minute range.  Other than that, the food was good, but the shrimp was overcooked, which made it hard to peel.  We picked the right seasonings for our steamed seafood. I would go back, but I would ask that everything come out on time.

rVqIq_fBnI-oXpClKMkGHw.text: The service was great here and the entire staff was friendly. The food was also good. We were looking for fried seafood. The calamari could have been seasoned a bit more but I added Cajun season (which was super hot) lemon and dipped them them in the marinara sauce and they were good. The shrimp was seasoned well and all the food was hot when it came out l. The catfish was good also. The only thing that I could have asked for was regular hot sauce (not tabasco) and a basket with both shrimp and catfish.

iy48uXdHt68PWqhSQbdZeQ.text: I've had Hot N Juicy located in Chinatown, it was a great dining experience. This time around, we had a bigger party and we opted to have drinks in our hotel and get Hot N Juicy to go. Since this location was closest we called in for the order and picked up. It tasted good, they were pretty quick. So where is the problem? 8 out of 10 people got the bubble guts. Seems that shrimp was the culprit. Thank god our suite had 3 bathrooms. Maybe it was just a bad batch or to go is not the way to go, I just know that it got most of our party sick. Their stomach hurt for 2 days and 1 of those days we had to drive back down to San Diego. I know, sweet ride right? I like Hot N Juicy, Next time though, I will opt for dining in at their Chinatown location (:

4DUVqO5JUFdpf7rG88gfrA.text: Terrible!!! Seafood wasn't good quality & drawn butter wasn't clarified! Got sick less than an hour of eating here!

rmipkxlMKywnTR28nv37ZA.text: Yummy!!!! My boyfriend and I shared the crawfish, and shrimp sampler. The shrimp were really good but the crawfish was ok. It was plenty to share.  It also came with potatoes, corn and sausages.  It was nicely seasoned and the staff was very friendly.

t5fujnRI9TPf15uzAg7uPQ.text: Love it! Did shrimp with sausages and potatoes in the Hot and Juicy extra hot seasoning. We ordered to go. Def HOT and Juicy! Been to a lot of Creole and crawfish joints. This place is one of my favs!

t4CTxyOhkNZVuqHC_IO-tw.text: Let me start by saying food is casual and a bit on the spicy side.  Plastic table sheet, all disposable sundries.  Food is good, flavorful, and fresh.   I had the calamari, etouffee, and shrimp po'boy.   Definitely coming here again.

Wjtbo9w7KUrvOjnT5HO8Ww.text: They are not cheap!!! They do not use fresh things...all frozen ... not whole a lot portion for the pricing either...

3_5EDyuXT_guL_WL_nAGPg.text: We went in for dinner! It was our first time and the food was delicious! We ordered shrimp, crawfish, king crab, sausage with corn and potatoes. We got the hot and juicy mild and it was hot!! Make sure to have water lol but it was yummy! I took a star off because of  the waiter. qAomKGTSIf3-Ry5bTP5KxQ.text: I'm a regular of Hot & Juicy and get it whenever I pass by. This is by far the best tasting location I have been to in Vegas! I will be coming back and location is very easy to find. Shrimp was very tasty coming out. Not heavy  on the garlic either. Keep being juicy!

Q26cKQmV1cqwJ-B5RNkkfQ.text: Went there for my boyfriends birthday dinner. Fast service, but it was pretty good! Nice little area on the strip. We went there during a slow time so not sure if the wait is usually long. We were seated right away.

Qw_Nh1NrPpuU2xWCOXPY5g.text: I'm so glad they have one on the Strip now. We planned to go to the Chinatown location, but saw this one. 0eWbd0F7KzBQZwRcztZe9A.text: When in Vegas, I always try my best to stop by for a bit here. This is my first time eating at this one located on the strip; I typically go to the one in Chinatown. We always order the seafood in Hot N Juicy sauce medium. The sauce is filed with minced garlic, Cajun seasoning, lemon pepper and other spices. The spice level is just perfect for my taste buds. It's not an immediate hit of spice, but it definitely builds up. I live out in LA and we do have one in Hollywood, but I do prefer the one here. If you're a Cajun seafood fan, I recommend trying this at least once.

vRhHZ4dJqpvXyAzDDWcpwQ.text: This place does not disappoint! I first tried Hot N Juicy a few years ago but in their location in Chinatown Las Vegas. I went with a group with 4 others and 3 of us shared 2lbs of shrimp, 1 lb crawfish, 1 lb clams. 1 lb mussels, 1.5 lb lobster with the hot n juicy seasoning and hottest spice level and one dozen oysters. The wait was about 45 minutes but with it being located inside the shops of Planet Hollywood hotel, it went by pretty quickly. Definitely one of my favorite places to get seafood!

OrSclvlkluMoyhrSHGneMQ.text: deliciousness! I discovered this place in Vegas, so happy they are in LA now. What a great find! very similar to boiling crab but with their own flavor.  It's so good I forgot to take pictures of the food.  supper messy but worth it!

1i0NNLpr2TL1qb_IQbuDUQ.text: I think it lived up to the hype, especially being on the strip. Wait time for a party of 2 on a Sunday evening was about 10 mins. Our waitress was very cool and attentive. Crab legs were the size of king crab legs other places. Decent size portions. I wish the hot and juicy sauce had more of a dry rub than so much liquid seasoning but overall it was really good.

cTk8F9eZuj4-MTeg3oavQA.text: I will first start by saying I went to this place knowing that it wasn't crawfish season yet!  But our waitress told us that up front as well.  I chose the "bag O' everything" and it was great!  The seasoning was spot on!  The restaurant is tucked away on a side street right off the strip and was very clean, staff was super nice!

cDJTmSVcikmok9hFa76fdg.text: I would come back for the shrimp. I had garlic butter, extra spicy. They were absolutely delicious. But the crawfish were tiny and not fresh at all. I'm from South Louisiana, so I love crawfish but won't get it from here.

QJjWj9DEMx7JGpZx6I3C_A.text: JR and Alex are the best! Amazing service. Since there was a wait to be sat we were at the bar first and JR took great care of us and then Alex took care of us at our table. Great food as well. Thank you to JR and Alex for making our experience so pleasant.

2-Y6_XYuPcZ9ahFYr6CTwg.text: Went here yesterday with some friends for an early dinner. Perfect timing before they got busy. Got seated right away by this friendly server named Nani. She introduced herself and explain things on the menu and even recommended us some appetizer. We got Cajun calamari which hits the spot. I ended up getting a pound of shrimp baby spice garlic butter flavor with some corn and a bowl of rice. Everything came out great! Perfect amount of all the spices. We ended up sharing everything and tried everyone's food.   Food was AMAZING. And even better with the exceptional service. All thanks to Nani.

wGkJGQXjCcDG_2BVhyvCDQ.text: The last time i came here it was amazing. The food is delicious. It will def have u licking ur fingers clean from the sauce. They offer you gloves,bibs, and lemons. The bibs and gloves r so helpful for those who have never been here before. Because it is down and dirty (but in a good way). They did offer to bib me this time which was weird... no offense but i can do it myself. I was greeted by Ashley and Nikki who helped me last time which was good to see. I love those two girls because they are just so sweet!! long wait and seem to be super busy. Paul was my server who did excellent! It's right next door to nacho daddy and bww. I'm telling you, the search is worth it. (If u don't know where it is) Lovvvveeeee ittttr.

lwK-rqokQtOa3ANbmjOLKQ.text: Great service and good food. We were told 30 minute wait but turned out to only be about 10. We got the snow crab, shrimp and oysters in hot and juicy sauce, would recommend the first two but not the oysters. Fries were thick cut, not my fave personally. We added corn and sausage and those were very yummy.

f8koU0uDsjLybItkg1L65A.text: Ok really.  When my friend asked me if I'd ever had  Hot n Juicy Crawfish- I was skeptical.  Is this a shot I don't know about?  Some sort of innuendo perhaps?  Then she explained what it was.  Seafood boil in a bag- sounds intriguing!  We headed on over and from the moment I walked in I was ready for the experience!!!! So first off, if you don't like to get dirty whilst eating- this is NOT the place for you.  They sit you down at a plastic covered table and slap down menus and bibs.  Yes, BIBS.  So if you're into getting your hands a bit slimy- you better just commit right now.  It's worth every bit! We got the Snow Crab, King Crab, and Shrimp.  Then you can add other boil items to it such as potatoes, corn, sausage, rice or rolls.  They bring out these double plastic bagged morsels of goodness and set em on your table and you just dig in.  It is messy and yummy and messy and garlicky and, well, heaven in a bag!!!!!  The spice meter is a bit on the high side, but thankfully our server let us know this in advance.  So I ordered a mild and my nose was running for sure.  Two of us got the garlic butter sauce, the other person got the hot and juicy- which is all the sauces combined.  We had a side of garlic butter and when it came out it was a brick red color- so as you can imagine- there was some heat.  But the funny thing was- we all agreed the side could have been a base to a really good soup base!   All in all everything was so good!  The atmosphere was fun, the bar was comprehensive, service was fast but laid back.  I would recommend this place to anyone traveling through.

hkpr_vjFdeEfbfHyv34VGw.text: TL;DR Come here for crappy non existent service and food that will leave you more dehydrated than the Sahara desert!   I honestly cannot believe this place has as good reviews as it does. Maybe just because it's a convenient seafood place to go to on the strip? Yes, we did have a party of 8 so understandably we knew it'd be a wait. However everything went downhill when we were seated upstairs. Water was given to us promptly as soon as we arrived but that was the only "service" we received the whole dining time. We all ordered various seafood (crawfish, shrimp, snow crab legs) at different spice levels. Our waitress tried to "warn" us about the spice levels but honestly that was a whole mess up. How can my friend's "baby spice" level be more spicy than the "medium (in actuality 'hot' spice level)"?? My friend who cannot tolerate any spice ordered baby spice for that particular reason yet she spit out the sausages in her bag because it was so spicy to the point of bitterness whereas the medium crawfish and shrimp I ordered was mild to the max! Two of our group got the seafood we ordered whereas the rest of the group had to wait at least another 20-25 min before everyone got their bags. Even after delivering my friend's bag of snow crab legs she had to wait an additional 15-20 min for a crab leg cracker! We must have asked 4 different servers and didn't even get any until most of us were halfway through done eating! Any additional requests for water refills, lemon, or salt and pepper were either ignored/forgotten. It was as if they knew they had served us badly near the end of our meal when they tried to check on us multiple times the last 15 minutes we were there. Even getting our check was a real pain in the neck. We watched the waitress who took our cards down for processing walk back upstairs, look at us, realize that she had taken our cards already 10 min ago then walk back downstairs to get our cards for ya because she had forgotten to bring them back! There are most definitely better places to dine on the strip. A hard pass and a never returning again for our group! Food was mediocre and no other seasoning besides super salty and mixed up spicy levels. Service was essentially nonexistent! I hope management sees this review and changes the policy on how customers who are seated upstairs are treated. Yes I understand that it's more work to walk upstairs and serve but that does not mean that it's ok either that we deserve to be forgotten or requests ignored! The most disappointing part of our Las Vegas trip for sure!

4RLWKfSKEM1oauyvyayHcw.text: I really wanted to give a full 5 stars but I can't due to our server's serving skills. Tasha forgot several simple things we asked for. Mind you we were only a party of 3. She offered to bring out water, we asked for one glass without ice, she brought back 3 glasses of water all with ice. We then asked her for a glass of club soda without ice 4 different times and she never brought it. She never once apologized for forgetting several times, she just said "okay" as if we didn't ask her 4 times. I then had to ask Travis for the club soda and he brought it to our table in less than 30 seconds. Tasha came to check on us to see if we needed anything, we asked her for crackers for our crab and 20 minutes later still no crackers. I look back and she was just standing next to the register by the kitchen. I then had to ask a different server and he was able to bring it back right away. I saw her sat down 2 guests next to us and she never came back to give them their drinks or take their order they had to wave to get their order taken. I saw that Travis was busy but he still went out of his way to take a order from Tasha's section. Aside from our server's service, the food was good, we ordered the drool combo, cajun fries, and an extra lbs of crawfish. Their house sauce is pretty good. The rest of the servers were super nice. Mary was very nice and helpful as well.

QNrNShX1WW3n3jX0-Ky1ig.text: Like any other hot n juicy around...its next to Buffalo Wild Wings and Nacho Daddy.  Had to wait about 10 mins to get a table for six. We ordered shrimp, fried catfish, calamari and corn fritters, plus two cajon fries. They were put of blue crab...boo!!  Everything was good and they kept the water glasses full, brought extra gloves for the ladies, etc.  Wish they would add some French bread to dip in the juice from the shrimp, etc.!!!

NpBHcCLNdO6B776ctHsEag.text: YIKES! I was really hoping to write a 5-star review but my experience wasn't as good as I thought it would be (giving this place a 3.5).   This restaurant was strongly recommended by a friend and on top of that it has some pretty neat reviews on yelp so my girls and I figured we'll give it a try. The atmosphere was very casual and laid back. All of the employees were extremely friendly and food was okay. So you are probably wondering why a 3.5 star so here it goes...The servers were friendly and consistently refilled out drinks but where they fell short on was the "over-promising" and "under-delivering." Our main server refilled our drinks multiple times and promised that the food should be out shortly but we still waited for a fairly long time. The server also promised that he'll come right back with the Seafood Cracker but never came back. We had to inform another employee.    The seasoning was alright. It wasn't anything spectacular. I still prefer "Firehouse Crawfish" back in my hometown (Sacramento) but needless to say, I'll come back here again. Besides the fact that the servers were over-promising the food wasn't horrible. It was still good.  **The really cool thing was they have a sink outside of the bathroom for you to wash your hands.

DajAONr00S0rsE2G39TgsQ.text: I stayed at the Elara hotel and when I heard Hot N Juicy was nearby, I was soooo happy!! This is maybe my third or fourth time at a Hot N Juicy (I've gone to other locations in Vegas and in Anaheim).  I've never been disappointed with Hot N Juicy. This visit I had a pound of crawfish and half doz sausage in the hot n juicy sauce with medium spice, and the fried catfish.  The crawfish was delicious. My girlfriends were saying their spice levels were spicier than expected and compared to other places. I thought it had a good kick but was manageable. I might've been able to handle Spicy instead of Medium. The sausage pieces were HUGE and had such good flavor!  The fried catfish - BOMB. Deep fried to perfection and it was sooo moist and flavorful. Probably the best fried catfish I've had at a joint like this. If I were hungrier I would've gotten it as a combo with Cajun fries, but the four pieces of catfish was perfect for me.

ycJM9w8LxJgYA8Khelguag.text: BUYER BEWARE  Let me start by saying that I have been a devout Hot N Juicy crawfish fan way before they expanded to NYC, so this one star review kills me but it has to be done before someone else gets swindled. (But seriously, I own the HNJ LV tank top with the crawfish playing blackjack....I once drove an hour during a cruise stop in Port Canaveral to get to the Orlando location. I loved this place)  Last May, I had a work trip take me to Las Vegas and dined at the location on the strip. My friend visited from out of town the next night and was taken back that I would choose HNJ of all places for a work expensed dinner. As a thank you for letting him stay with me, he went the next day to purchase me $50 gift card from the LV strip location to enjoy once back in NYC.   Fast forward to February - I thought I would finally put my gift card to use here at HNJ NYC. While cashing out, the waitress came over to tell us that there was only $0.01 on the card. My initial reaction was that my friend's transaction never went through but wanted to make sure he wasn't charged $50 for a gift card that was never activated. I gave him a call and sure enough he was charged $50 by HNJ LV in May. I asked him to send me proof of purchase so I can pass along to them thinking that was all I needed to correct the error yet HNJ refused to honor it.  Keep in mind that this happened in February and I've been trying to resolve this and not be the person that takes to yelp to air out all grievances but unfortunately this is a scam and want to prevent anyone else from experiencing this -- imagine handing over your money to a company in good faith, and then gifting someone a $0.01 card-- not a good look for the company!   Here is a list of every single excuse HNJ has given me as to why they cannot honor this gift card: 1) You could not purchase gift cards during this time using a credit card so it's not even possible  2) This gift card number shows that it was purchased in February 2017 and then used in June 2018 3) My complaint with the BBB is invalid because I am the recipient and not the purchaser   My issues with the above 1) If you can't purchase gift cards with a credit card then pull up the transaction details from my friends purchase and let me know why he has a perfectly even $50 charge on his credit card statement from HNJ 2) Your gift cards don't even include a security pin, just a straight up gift card number. If they don't include a pin and you claim you can't even purchase them with a credit card, then how am I supposed to trust you have the infrastructure to ensure multiple people weren't issued the same gift card number? 3) Don't worry, the purchaser will also be filing a complaint with the BBB  This has gone on for months over a $50 gift card despite providing them with PoP. Hardly any way to do business.

HpYBtCsvBaTOLEsxBsUmTw.text: Hot n juicy. Sounds like a hooker on the streets but it ain't a cheap one. Let me tell you, I was not very impressed with this place. I've been to many similar styled places and me hearing people hype up this place got me excited but it was a disappointment. A heart breaker.  The only PROS: Most standard crab and crawfish places that do the Louisiana boil style have a standard of 4 sauces. (Cajun, lemon pepper, garlic butter, and all 3 mixed) but this place had 5. Also the spice levels can range from baby spice to extra spicy.   When you go to these type of places.. you have to get their signature sauce which for this place was hot n juicy sauce. It was OK. We got it for all our items (shrimp,crawfish, and mussels). It was a little too pastey tasting. I also didn't like the fact that the crawfish was frozen crawfish. Yeah they were alive at one point ...but there's a big difference in the taste. It definitely killed the vibe for the sauce they have. Also, I felt the medium spice was more spicy than medium. Most places I've been to I've been able to handle the spice but this was just berserk.   When you get your order it comes in a seafood bag. Whether you eat it for here or to go. Pricing is pretty hefty, but hey it's Vegas!!

xOADEIbeNL0B9cXFppXKyw.text: It was the third time I was here and it seems the place went downhill. Service was all over the place and none of the staff had designated tasks. It was hard to catch one of them since they were all running around uncoordinated and the place wasn't even that packed. Had to wait to get crab claw crackers and that took forever since they were being washed (they need more of them). The crab claws were thin and the crawfish were small. Honestly your best bang for your buck is the shrimp. I remember this place being better.

gWpX8qslbkcBP8ffbnO_uQ.text: I came here while I was in town in part because of the reviews I saw on Yelp. I am a lover of seafood and Hot N Juicy Crawfish did not disappoint.  I ordered shrimp and crab legs of course. You are allowed to choose your level of  hotness I certainly didnt choose the hottest. I got mild and lemon garlic and it was delicious. It was cheaper than I expected and we didnt have to wait long to be seated.  I saw a few reviewers say they weren't allowed in with swim suits. I wasn't  wet and I did have on a short and shirt so maybe not having on a see through top will work when trying to come here after a pool party.  Also they have one in my city so I can't wait to go.

mpRx1YQ8ObpT3Ob_eT31xQ.text: Love this simple yet fabulous concept of Hot N Juicy! Not a fancy establishment but clean. Tables are covered in plastic wrap for easy clean up and I love that they issue a bib and plastic see thru gloves for easy handling of the food.    Dress is casual and staff is friendly.   When ordering you pick your:  1. specific seafood such as shrimp, mussels, crab or any combination  2. spiciness level from mild to super hot 3. then you pick your seasoning (ranges from garlic butter, old Bays etc)   I always order a half pound of shrimp (they are huge) and they have the head on them, 2 pieces of corn in garlic butter and Hawaiian rolls. The shrimp tastes so fresh and is very filling and satisfying! The shrimp are very easy to peel.  My mouth waters every time that I tell someone about this place!  I wish we had them at home In NC!  Be sure to check them Out!

GCKuvnSJUCmPM25bEScDww.text: I've been to several versions of this seafood boil style restaurant. I ordered shrimp, sausage,potatoes,and corn on the cob. The food was right on par with what I've had in the past. Everything had great flavor and was hot and fresh. The only thing I'm not a fan of is the plastic bags not being served on a tray. With a tray you can rip the bags partially and still keep the juices contained. The table gets way to messy for my liking and I know for most people it's all a part of the experience. Also I'm use to having the option of having the head on or off with the shrimp and here You get the head on. I do love the option of ordering the shrimp by the half pound instead of a whole pound like other places. With all that being said I had a great visit and would definitely go back.

vPchBpL3tZA8f65UmWXWcA.text: It was my first time eating crawfish, and I thought the unique Hot n Juicy seasoning was so good. I simply ordered 1lb of crawfish, mild and I wish I had ordered the medium. Our waiter said the medium can be pretty spicy but as someone with a decent spice tolerance, I felt like the mild did not have enough of a kick. The add-ins, like potatoes and corn, are fantastic to have to help fill you up. I also ordered mozzarella sticks but they were nothing special. The service was fantastic as we came in with a party of ten, were seated within 15 minutes, and were able to go Dutch in the bill. Our server was very patient with splitting the bill even when we saw his face fall a little hearing that we wanted to pay separate lol.

Fun experience and delicious flavors! We got the shrimp and crawfish with Cajun fries. Super good! I recommend it :)

a88AeL8ZakIoj-KgGZ028w.text: Coming from New York and having "The Boil," this place was a complete let down. First, there are no buckets to put your shells. Everything just goes on the table. The gloves are also very cheap and thin that you can feel the food burning through. When you take your gloves off, you'll also realize the sauce seeps right through and your fingers are dirty. Totally defeats the whole purpose of wearing the gloves. The calamari is dry and not as amazing as I expected. However, the shrimp was very fresh...we ordered two pounds of it. My dad thought the catfish po'boy sandwich was the best. Overall, we'd had better seafood with the same concept but perhaps for las vegas, it is something different and delicious for folks nearby. I do recommend to try The Boil in New York though! This just isn't a place I would go out of my way to come if I came back to Vegas.

You wear plastic bibs and where plastic gloves and pick up your food from the plastic bags break it apart and eat.  The crawfish are truly juicy and delicious and the other items were tasty as well.  I would definitely recommend this place when you are looking for something different from the standard fare.  A very fun experience.

7fob_u0sN4zg5jv9u_fm0A.text: Ordered from uber eats while in vegas for Labor Day. Crawfish? In vegas? It sounded like a challenge to a native Texan with a French creole last name.   I called four times to ask different questions. The same young lady answered each time . She giggled the third and fourth time when I said "hey, it's me again." God bless her. She was very helpful and knowledgeable.   We ordered shrimp and crawfish. At first I was disappointed.. but when I got deep into the bag I was delighted.  The flavoring was great and spicy enough that I had to take a break in between pounds.   My only complaint is that they don't seem to let the crawfish sit as long while preparing but this is the trade off for fast food type with numerous options to choose from.   I will def go again.

b4NEgElXQQr5A4VTvt-xig.text: Ok so let's talk about Hot N Juicy...by now in case you do not know let me inform you that I am from Louisiana. So...my standards for all things seafood and coined as Cajun or creole are through the roof high. My favorite season of the year is CRAWFISH SEASON. I live for mud bugs and all cuisine Cajun and creole. I could go on and on talking about how no food is better than what we have in Louisiana but I will spare you at this time. So, Hot N Juicy....they don't have high rating for nothing! My friends and I needed a crawfish fix and this spot was literally across the street from where we were staying. We ordered: crawfish, corn, fish platters, shrimp po boy, Cajun fries, sweet potato fries, and deep fried brownies. Almost forgot to throw in the snow crab legs. We got our seafood medium heat and seasoned in Hot N Juicy. The spice kick was just right. The seasoning stuck. It was nose running, lip burning glory! Since moving to Cali where the food has been subpar at best, Hot N Juicy was a nice change of pace for me tastebuds. I now have to see if the one in West Hollywood ranks in close comparison. The service was good. Our server kept our glasses full and made sure all was well. The prices were at market value. I cannot complain about market prices but what I can say is in Louisiana we are fortunate enough to get seafood for much less. Typically crawfish is sold at $2.99/lb live and depending  on time of season cooked ranges from $3.99-7.99/lb. I understand a business has to make a profit and it is not like crawfish are being plunked out the water in the west. Thank goodness home is only a short plane ride up the road.  I said all this to say...eat Hot N Juicy.

tEk6E3rdAcVrBv8uPZrhkg.text: Second time we've been here. Writing this as we eat. Very delicious and filling. Its packed but our waiter Christian is super sweet and attentive. Will definitely be back on our next visit to Vegas!

F4WpDRk8daoOq29Q7Ejq4g.text: Good for groups, no more than 7 but ideal for 2-4 people at a time because the space isn't large. Yummy seafood, chill and laid back vibes also! My guest ordered snow crabs and shrimp (comes in bags with your choice of seasoning, wet or dry). You have the option of adding small baked potatoes and corn in your bags of seafood. It gets messy, just so you know! And, your waiter will give you the tools to crack the shellfish. On the dryer side, you can order fried seafood baskets with your choice of regular, cajun or sweet potato fries. I ordered a 4-pc fried catfish basket with a basket of crispy pork skins. Customer service is decent, but honestly you're just gonna be focused on the food anyway!

80aPPfZSJnYm86ElRKxMbQ.text: I came in today and I had Jennifer as my server. Although the restaurant was super busy the whole time I was there she made sure I was a priority. As soon as I got to my table she greet my husband and I be brought over water with lemon. I was extremely parched from waiting and I was so happy I didn't have to ask for water. She explained the menu to me and the different seasonings and spices so that it was easier for me to pick. After I gave her my order, she let me know that although she was my server if she needed anything at all I could ask any other server but of course I wanted her to help me out. The whole time she made sure I had my drinks refilled and reassured me that my food was coming out soon after she checked the food in the kitchen. Without hesitation she gave me everything I needed and I appreciated that so much. She made my experience amazing and she also put my bib on which I thought was funny. When I asked her refill my water and bring me a lid to go she offered to get me a new cup as well. 100% will be returning and asking for her to be my server. 10/10 would recommend to anyone I know. Thank you so much, Jennifer!

JNIJzglWsf9LVkVUEQMdJA.text: One word to describe this place: DELICIOUS!!!!! This is by far theee best seafood restaurant I've ever been to....the baby cajun spice crab leg sauce is off the charts!! Don't be intimidated by the food wrapped  in plastic bags...you'll need it to avoid getting that delicious crab leg sauce all over yourself! Also get the rice and corn on cob. You can put some sauce on top of the rice and enjoy!

DI6OZrtIq_DaSsQ9ePbRDg.text: Go to the Spring Mountain location or Eastern...The sauces at this location are watered down and they don't put in enough sauce to cover the seafood.

WDBUDIrHYy6yOnruh7HndA.text: My friend and I were so happy this spot was open late. Not only was the food amazing, the service was 5 star. I had only been going to boiling crab and have now found my new shrimp spot in Vegas. Ashley was so helpful and let us try some of the flavors to help us better decide what we wanted. The oysters were so fresh! What a great experience.

-JlGtFUCHX3tm9w3VxICIw.text: WOW! Took my kids here to Hot N Juicy Crawfish for dinner while in Las Vegas for a wedding. I was excited that it was walking distance from where we were staying. I LOVE, LOVE ME SOME SEAFOOD and they prepared it perfectly with the right amount of yummy seasoning and their kick ass sauce flavors - Oh My! Started our order with juicy Cajun seasoning, medium spice level, 2 lbs shrimp, 1 lb Black mussels, 1 lb of king crab legs, potatoes, rice, corn and sausage. Oh how I wanted to order more, but there wasn't a microwave in our room for any leftovers. Nonetheless, we were stuffed and happy to go walk it off a bit lol. While we were sitting there, letting the food settle, we all had a laugh as we looked around and noticed everyone wearing over gloves to eat as we were looking at our messy, saucy hands waiting to waddle to the hand washing stations. I mean, we're Pacific Islander and we do eat with our hands, so maybe with that observation, we weren't offered those over gloves lol. No worries, didn't need them anyways ha! Thank you Hot N Juicy Crawfish for an amazing dinner! See ya next time :p

DHhZ8eAK2su1A7Zj3pl3GA.text: Now this Hot N Juicy is pretty much the best in Vegas. I luv the setup and the food I had was amazing! I eat extra spicy food so not much spicy impresses me but I was impressed of how it made my mouth sting a bit! Service was fast and the wait wasn't too long. I went on a Sunday night an hour or two before closing. When I order Hot N Juicy I like to have them go easy on the butter so my flavor can be rich and less runny! The prawns were huge as well as nice size crawfish. The Cajun fries were amazing and the waitress I believe was Ashley, who definitely made sure we were well taken care of. I will definitely being returning!

ye7A8grnD_g977ojtpTK9w.text: This hot n juicy was AMAZING. Hospitality at its finest, for being a busy restaurant serving all kinds of people they definitely went all out by showing gratitude and passion for there guests. This will be a place I will be coming to often! Make sure to ask for Destiny, we were sat at a small table during busy hours, and she took the time out of her busy shift to move us to a more spacious table. Jeff the person who seemed like manager at the time offered us different varieties of drinks and desserts! Ivy was very kind and accommodating! Saivon was very articulate with the menu and recommended we try the deep fried brownies! and the bartender Michael oooh weee, spectacular conversation and good recommendations of drinks, the huckleberry was to die for! gTdonKSwU7cbVQo9y2r0yw.text: Please open up a restaurant in Oregon!  I forgot our servers name but he was super friendly. He gave everyone fist bumps and was very helpful and patient for the newbies at our table. The food then came out very quickly!  The boils here are not exactly NOLA but it comes very close in terms of the flavor. Yesterday I got 1 lb of garlic butter shrimp (medium spice), 1 lb of Hot N Juicy flavor (all of the flavors mixed) snow crab (medium spice), and 1 lb of fresh Cajun flavored crawfish (medium spice). They were all SO good! I can't even say which flavor was better. We also added corn and potatoes, and our server hooked it up with an extra corn (which may have been a mistake but I'll take it). This was also the only Cajun restaurant I've been to that hands out gloves to the customers to peel the boils - super convenient for us.  The 3 pounds was $56 total... pretty spendy compared to the south. But I'm from Oregon and nothing there tastes as good so I'd definitely come back every time I'm in Vegas!
