LRIImOZs-6iJMhYL18XBaA.text: I love seafood and this place did not disappoint!!  WEAR THE BIB or some old work close cause it can get messy with the boil in bags.  I even added a shrimp pot boy after I ate my first order!!  Cajun fries are CAJUN!!  Place was empty when we walked in damn near, but PACKED when we left!!  Service was great and waitresses are pretty!!  Definitely a Vegas return spot!!

YBNW_zcaOsPh6geHyAUfoA.text: We arrived right before closing and was still treated with great service. I ordered the shrimp med in heat and that was spicy but good.  My only issue was the raw oysters,  they taste funny and had a weird texture to them. Other than that food and consumer services was good

mK3fSswDm_jyyRl8K0EtDw.text: Great food and superb service specially Nani, Alexis and Ashley, its the best place for fresh seafood and wonderful deep fried stuff Try something different every time you come here you can never go wrong

mlG5sD6HdHCVXd6mNFzypw.text: If I could give zero stars I would.  I live in DC, but came to Las Vegas for a Bachelorette weekend.   In DC, I regularly go to their Hot N Juicy location.  I have an allergy to crawfish and shrimp, but can eat crab.  At the DC location I make them aware of my allergy and they assure me that they can accommodate me.  Well, in Las Vegas they tell me that they cannot accommodate my allergy and that EVERYTHING is cross contaminated, including the fried foods (like a basket of fries would be fried in the same grease as the calamari...gross!).  In DC, I have eaten there numerous times and never had that issue.  But today, while my friends enjoyed all their food I had to sit and wait until they finished to get another food option.  I would assume that the chains would have the same policy to accommodate customers (literally, just not boil in the same water) but I wasn't afforded that with 6 other paying customers. Not a great experience and will not be returning.  Such a small request but they were not willing to accommodate while another location will, I'm confused.

uXQ6JyEw1_V8l7CJhAJ4sQ.text: One of the best places I've had in Las Vegas for crawfish! The size of the crawfish was great, however, I have not been here after crawfish season. The few times I've been here, it was never crowded and the there was practically no wait (even on the weekends).

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zd6gB66yYh7MBcuAYARmDQ.text: First stop to vegas was this place. I'm so glad they open late because I was so hungry after my flight. Me and my friend ordered fried calamari (which tasted like any calamari you can get anywhere else), the green mussels (best mussels I've ever had! The juice they mixed with the mussels was amazing, I dipped all my other food in it), and "the drool" which is plenty enough to share with someone else. It had shrimp, crab legs, Crawfish, corn and sausages. We got the "hot n juicy" flavor which they're known for. I love the fact that they give you bibs and gloves" so you don't get too messy. Will definitely eat here again!!

O76uXh1M7t89e0aXCbmn5g.text: the bomb! the location was perfect! Expect it to be pricey since it is located at the strip. Due to how busy the area was the servers tend to kind of ignore what u ask for. Make sure you ask them everything u need at one time so u wouldn't have to wait for extra order. The front lady was nice, i could tell they're all tired so i guess they don't smile that much anymore which is understandable! hahah the servings of the shrimps and sauces were even, which is so nice atleast i didn't ran out of sauce.

Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SHRIMP KING! hahaha

ZVFesK54IH8b3DYyzcNgtw.text: You'll stand forever at the front of this restaurant before anyone notices you or attempts to sit you. There's a giant staircase blocking a clear view of the front door and there is no one tending to the guests walking in. It's like it's only wait staff that are busy with tables.   I ordered 3 lbs of crawfish. I like the traditional, boiled, Louisiana crawfish flavoring so I got it "Louisiana at medium." Perfect amount of spice for what I wanted to have. It was a slow burn and by the last lb, my lips were on fire. Definitely wouldn't want to try spicy. I like to enjoy my food and not suffer too much.   It was very expensive at $15/lb of crawfish. The combos with shrimp are cheaper, but then you end up getting a lot of filler in your bag with a dozen sausages, handful of potatoes, and a few corn on the cobs. I wanted to keep it to all the crawfish.   The sinks outside the bathroom are nice. No need to wait in line just to wash your hands before and after you eat.   Delicious food. The only bad thing about this restaurant is lack of dedicated hostess to seat customers as they come in.

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DwLrpkqcJui1zxi0W-OLoA.text: This place reminded me of my experience with seafood in New Orleans. It's DELICIOUS! The crawfish are yummy once you get past their beady little eyes. As is the crab. Calamari is yummy but I recommend getting the Cajun version as the plane version was bland. However, be warned - the Cajun flavoring here is quite hot! Being brown, I'm accustomed to high spice levels however the Cajun with medium spice had my nose leaking. Glad I didn't get spicy. Waiters are extremely friendly and it's in a good location.

7_rrWFFke8Y2DwejiMIzcg.text: This was our first time here and we'll be back for sure. I had the Juicy Cajun seasoning on my 1lb of shrimp and it was just right. My husband had the shrimp po boy with Cajun fries and he enjoyed it. This will be a stop next time also.

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Fries
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Po Boy with Cajun fries.

rzuCNknrroIPSYLewf1mng.text: The food is really amazing!! Fresh and meaty seafood. Sauce is great. We had the hot n spicy with baby spice (slight kick). Definitely worth coming to again and again. We had black mussels, snow crabs legs, crawfish, potatoes and corn. Crawfish was great!! Did not get the shrimp... not clean and head on... gross. However, we got there in time for happy hour and got the shrimp po boy lunch special instead. It was great like everything else. Got the happy hour Long Island ice tea. They were not shy with the liquor! This was my first time in Vegas and I'm still amazed how we can leave restaurants with alcohol!!!   I am taking a star off for not easily finding this place. After getting dropped off at Planet Hollywood we literally had to ask 4 different people, but it was well worth it. Service was good.

lDrsGl9AhyjGmVh-KfoxGw.text: Extremely disappointing. Ordered 1 pound of snow crab it was either old or over cooked. The crab broke apart in the shell for every leg and had to be dug out. The service was extremely slow. Took forever to get butter and a refill of Dr.Pepper all while my crab got cold. My brother sent back his shrimp for being too hard and my sister in law ate half of a poorly seasoned catfish po'boy. My stomach has hurt since I left.   Tip: Bellagio has $37.99 buffet- all you can eat crab legs that are perfectly prepared.  Do yourself a favor. DONT GO!   (Typed from my bathroom)

vfARO4DXJsx_1taHOA6hFA.text: We had an amazing experience here mainly because of JR!! We met him at the bar waiting for our seats. He served us a few drinks & those were made really well.  Then, he said he will be our server too! He took care of us really well- checking on us & making us feel like we've known him for years. We will definitely come back because of him & request him.  It's important that if you go out to eat, not only is the food good, but the experience is even better & JR delivered that!

QSVlwsY-pgJDQySa3TUx4A.text: Best dining experience in Vegas during the Halloween week visit. Can't get enough of it's delicious seafoods that we rushed to go to their NY location day after arriving the city.   The spices used to their seafoods were the best I ever had - hot, spicy, juicy and garlic flavorful. I ordered their least  spicy level and it was great. Imagine if I get the best one? It will definitely be super hot and yummy!  The fun of this dining experience even though they provided plastic hand gloves, you could eat with your bare hands. How cool is that !   The location is convenient to mass transit. I heard that they normally line before getting seated. Luckily on this night , we were seated right away.    Highly Recommended .

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YzQaSbULg_DeqlvwfPlkRg.text: 6 million restaurants in Vegas and I went here twice. King crab legs extra spicy please and thank you. And yes I'm coming back tomorrow. This is such a simple concept. I love it. I've seen it before in other cities. If anyone wants to open one up in denver...let a brother know.

9kjdO5jif7G70PMh-qqfJw.text: Worst service ever. It started out great, but now that I think about it, it was just bad. I ordered 1lb of shrimp and 1lb of crawfish, husband ordered the fried stuff, it was good, but we went here because I was craving seafood. The waiter never suggested the combo of get your feet wet (which I would have recommended.) After my order, I never saw my waiter again until I asked for gloves and guess what? He gave me the check while I was half in. I was pissed. No apologies for bringing the check early, or anything.   I recommend going somewhere else for better service. Food was cheap, but also mediocre and you can get better seafood elsewhere on the strip for way better service.   The only thing good? Spice level is insane.

ikCGSfujHWeoq4v2IbZRYQ.text: MUST if you love seafood! Skip their fried calamari and just go for the seafoods options in the bag.  Mild Juicy Cajun was spicy enough if you're not into spicy spicy. Your nose will still run a bit and you'll need to drink lots of water! But sooo delicious! If you're more sensitive to spicy, then, definitely go for baby spice!

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L4QtbaEjsk1LmPGYnYqGFg.text: Legit Vegas strip food. The Garlic butter was the most delicious delicious sauce ever. We had a party of 12. We were seated rather fast relatively speaking. We ordered some of everything. Shrimp, king snow crab, regular crab legs, catfish platter, mussels. It was all yummy. Everyone enjoyed their food and were sufficiently satisfied. Sometimes you can get seafood and eat all your food and still be hungry. The portions are huge. Most ppl in my party ordered multiple things...like an order shrimp and an order of crab legs. I had the mussels and catfish platter. I wanted lobster but they were out. I was disappointed but my food was delicious so I'll just have to get it next time. The prices are fairly decent as well. Decent for a typical meal on the strip but also decent for the type of food. I think the prices were comparable or even less than what you would pay at a crab boil spot at home. I definitely highly recommend this place. The one downfall was they were out of crackers especially for the long snow crab eaters. They complained that it really hurt their hands opening the crab with their bare hands. A must visit for a lunch or dinner option while you're in Vegas.

XY0cK9hVgqBLwPcYfUux9Q.text: Absolutely delicious. I make one or two visits every time I come to Vegas. I love it it's my favorite seafood spot ever!!!   Get the hot and juicy flavor it's heavenly. Not buttery not pasty. The only thing is the place is filled with young ppl servers but the service is usually ok. They are very stingy with their food but it's understandable and worth it. DONT try the raw oysters they were rotten and disgusting. But other than that no complaints. I will always return

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rotten raw oysters:(

YbHoHW-hPNpGiIaiZJt0gA.text: JR saved what would have been a horrible dining experience at Hot N Juicy.. and he wasn't even our waiter!! We ordered a pound of snow crab and shrimp and a dozen oysters. JR stepped up and filled in where our waiter was completely oblivious to our basic request for crab cutters and limited knowledge of the menu. We were unhappy with an order and when we had issues with our bill, it was JR who contacted his manager to make the correction and took care of the situation for us.   This review was solely to let the management staff know they've got a great employee and we appreciate his excellent customer service.

iwwx4Mb3OoN_ORi0KjW3cQ.text: Most flavorful crawfish sauce I've EVER tasted! I plan on coming back each and every time I'm in Vegas - without fail! I'm totally a believer! That's it. Don't waste your time on anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got to have my Stella
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 lbs of goodness
Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra spicy sauce on the side for me :)

1XHNuYsW5tcmvZ8U3xlr6Q.text: Best spot on the strip to go for Cajun seafood! I used to go out of the strip to eat at this joint but now this location opened up it's so much more convenient for the commute.  The entrance is off the strip, around the corner from the McDonald's. So keep an eye out for it! It is a pretty big location, two floors so lots of seats. They don't take reservations at night, first come first serve.  The clams, shrimp, and snow crab is great, my favourite go to. Hot n juicy and garlic butter are the sauces I always go to, and I like a good kick so I like at least a medium spice. Clams and mussels are only by lbs, just remember that when you order. If you like Cajun food and lazy to go off strip, this is definitely the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Hot N Juicy Crawfish - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam and snow crap

8HPSfbd34jcVAubAYa3r6g.text: During this trip to Vegas we have eaten here twice. The food is perfect. The spice is on point, and the portions are plentiful. Put on your bib, your gloves and be ready to get messy and slurp on some crawfish. The corn and potatoes are delicious. The secret star of the show are the sausages.

EKuZIPXQ-iZSs2n_7JA_-g.text: Amazing service!! Natalie was friendly, professional, personable and amazing!! The food was perfect!!! Just the right amount of spice and all the flavor you could imagine!!! I will go there every time I am in Vegas!!!

NvLwdWcODKWDMVxtuMJFtQ.text: We were walking the Strip and stopped here for an early dinner our first evening in Vegas. It's located next to Planet Hollywood and was only a few minutes from our hotel. We started with crispy pork skins, calamari, and corn fritters. All were good but I'd definitely order the corn fritters again. The dipping sauce served with them was yummy. We shared a pound of medium spiced crawfish, but I can't remember the seasoning. This isn't the place if you aren't ready for messy eating. I don't like messy, finger eating foods but I was a Louisianan for more than ten years so I knew what to expect. They give you huge plastic bibs and gloves to combat the messiness though. This was a great experience. I haven't had crawfish in years, and it was a delight to have such a great Cajun meal in Vegas.

tiLxp-ejEMqHRrD2nd4bkw.text: visited the location in Las Vegas I had a really good time. We had the shrimp,crab legs,clams, and fried shrimp loved every bit of it. I had the garlic butter sauce which was delicious,only thing I didn't like was everything came in a separate bag which made lots of plastic bags on the table but would def go back over and over again

EWTB1IAcdYt1m8VwWbMALg.text: This is one of the best places to visit in Vegas Destiny and the other servers were amazing. There was not wait time for food, drinks or whatever. Everyone was extremely friendly and kind. Thanks Destiny for making this experience one of the best of my trip. Can't wait to come back.   With that said Twinnis out!

E-lzDJi4EdkP7dxPw9yjcw.text: Food and service was amazing. Waitress was very welcoming and recommend great cocktails

1zJSNSoq0tZMpf2W3hOK3Q.text: Have to say this place is really good. I loved their happy hour. Buy 1 Beer Get 1 Free.  Had to rate a 3 for the shrimp and crab legs. Their hot n juicy season with a spicy level was a bit to sweet for my liking. But service was great!  Corn fritters were amazing!! Omg and the Cajun Calamari was to die for!

L3UhJU4ZWtn3Uctdo--e_A.text: Pretty good bagged up seafood.  Better quality seafood than most, but their bathrooms were unkempt and disgusting.  They should really hire someone to just take care of that if they can't have people rotate in to clean it.  Decent service, but also it's all hands and not forks or plates so it gets messy with lots of used napkins.  It was good, but a little dirty in there.

IYJrpTp1w1PLs70PAKsGkw.text: Beside not having live crawfish; for it's not in season; I enjoyed the food. I had order the medium spicy shrimp and crawfish with hot n juicy, also a side of cajun chicken tenders and fries. Service was good as well. Our server check up on us a reasonable amount and made sure our drinks were always full.

eNaq_vUMJdSsCXkXIk-H0g.text: Plastic table covering, plastic bibs and plastic gloves in order to tuck into a huge bag of marinated, sliced claw flush, shrimp, corn, whole potato and sausages. WOW!!!!  What fantastic food and such a wonderful experience. One of the highlights of our stay in Vegas. Thank you too, to the super polite and fun staff.

DtVGif3619aOOTPaBG3-pw.text: Just wow. If anyone has ever been to New Orleans and appreciates creole food, Hot N Juicy at Planet Hollywood is THE place to go if you're trying to get your Cajun seafood fix!   The etouffe here literally tastes like it was made straight from the bayou and served at your table. So flavorful and has a nice kick of spice... and I'm not really into spicy foods. But this is just the right amount. PS - if you don't know what etouffe is, it resembles a sort of gumbo-like dish. It's amazing.  The regular fried calamari was really good and comes with a side of marinara and lemons. We were hesitant to order the Cajun calamari because it's a little on the spicier side.  I was afraid that the pound of shrimp with a mixture of all sauces (aka it's called the Hot N Juicy sauce) with baby spice was going to be too spicy for me. But baby spice was great. My heart was happy. PS - there's different sauces you can choose from like garlic butter, lemon pepper, Cajun, etc. or you might as well throw them all together and savor the flavors.

IsjUi82t57GNM_5eTNg8Aw.text: Lord, My family cannot get enough of Hot N Juicy that we went back twice in one week. The crab legs are always great the hot n juicy seasoning is perfection. The catfish is great too. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was really relaxed. We will Definitely be back and has traveled across the country to eat it at each Hot N Juicy restaurant.

gV2TmT8zDGZX745D7sLYNw.text: Came here with some friends.  Waitress was very nice and service was great.  She gave us a sample of the frozen crawfish to see if we wanted to order it .   We ended with the snow crabs , clams and shrimp.  Having been to some other seafood places I thought the food was okay ... some of the seasoning was super salty and some had barely enough seasoning ...   Although the food wasn't that great to me I thought the service was very good and she was very sweet and attentive

pGxYq4eo_o41GonFx6lmbw.text: I stop by this place every time I come to Vegas. The flavors are delicious. I've never had to wait a long time to get my food. The staff is always polite.

VXXK1e7yG241jqUTeYZZTA.text: There is no exaggeration about the smell inside of the restaurant. It took me a little bit to adjust, but it was worth it. Our server was kind and thorough when explaining the menu to us and answering our questions. Collectively, we had  1/2 pound of shrimp, sausage, corn, French fries, Cajun calamari, and catfish. Oh a beer from tap and a strawberry lemonade.   The only thing that was disappointing was the catfish. It was a little fishy and I did not enjoy the batter.   Would definitely go again.

Jy4uNqEb7gu4rrCERhh_hQ.text: We came last night for our bachelorette party. Ashley and the other works were the best! Service was perfect and the food was phenomenal. If you're in Vegas this is a must! Thanks Ashley and team! You guys rock and made our experience that much better

E7z_w2en_Fl4NAiNkpzCZA.text: Alex the server was amazing!. My first time at the establishment Alex made the experience of a party of 4 the best that we've experienced in Vegas thus far! As a current hospitality supervisor I appreciate effort to makeh us feel at home away from home. The establishment is great as well but I will always appreciate good service and Alex gave nothing short!!

7FyVKaeZKud9cpZ1MWJHhg.text: The food was delicious and our waiter was amazing. It was his second day and the person training him sucked! She was very rude to him and we could hear her yelling at him from our table that he was getting thing wrong. I got clams, half pound of shrimp, 2 pieces of corn, and a potato. My corn and potato's literally took over an hour, and I had to ask for them about 3 times until I finally said to forget them. They gave me them complimentary but by the time they got to the table they were cold, which obviously means they were just sitting out in the back.

SDsKAeCcOyYEH1jtuwoTCg.text: Enjoying Happy hour, celebrating my 1 year Wedding Anniversary with my wife. Hot N Juicy is our favorite spot!!! Ashley & Alexis were amazing & so attentive!!! Best bartenders/servers in Vegas!!! I felt at home!

uPWOrt_SyT3vrdhat8vmBg.text: This place never disappoints... It's always good eats ... Thanks to Ashley and Alexis for the great service and drinks ... I would suggest this as a must hit when in Vegas...

azilZCCvJ9uL0rP9F0i8IA.text: I had high hopes for this place, but it was a let down. It took us FOREVER to find it, as it is tucked away behind a shopping center. After finding it, we sat down to order, but were not greeted by a waitress for another 10 minutes. She finally gave us menus, and we ordered. Another 30 minutes passed by. Someone else delivered our food. We had not seen our waitress again, but they only delivered HALF of what we ordered. I had to get up and walk to the bar, because I STILL had not seen my waitress. I found her, let her know we were missing food and sat back down. Someone else brought the rest of our order a few minutes later. Our waitress never refilled our water, I had to ask someone else for gloves and crab crackers.   As far as flavor goes, it was meh. The crawfish was frozen and small. We ordered a pound of crab legs as well, and got 3 legs. Now, I am not a chemist or anything, but I knew that wasn't a pound.  The potatoes were cold in the center. Corn was soggy.   Overall, poor, expensive, disappointment in Vegas. Don't waste your time.

gtdnbnXMHcG7mwP73htL2A.text: Just got done with a long drive from oc to Vegas and waiting to come some gamble some drink but us we chose the hot n juicy first. And it was great really love the way they put in and pack the freshness and flavor in the food. Got the little bit of everything mix and it just hit the spot. Can't wait to go back again to Vegas and keep it a tradition every time we go it's the hot and juicy first that kicks off the trip in Vegas. And the staff always provide 5 star service no matter how busy it was. We go seated and served in no time 15-20 or so and we were digging in  to the pile of fish. Love it can't say much more.

2ZUDx1zL4pc-TWAcgMNtXA.text: It's my favorite Cajun seafood place in town!!! All those others crawfish places can't beat HnJ! Why!? Cuz it's all about the sauce baby!! Their HnJ sauce is so special to my heart and most to my mouth!! If you like spicy flavorful garlicky kinda food HnJ is ya kinda place!!! I left one star out cuz we are in the desert seafood here comes frozen

XnUlxLdbOGsqrW26HgAqaw.text: Let me start off by saying, the food is delicious. The service on the other hand, was horrible. I went in with a group of 8 total ( 4 couples/4 tabs). We received most of our food at a reasonable time but the guys in our group ordered crab which didn't come out with our food. We were told cooking time was longer once we asked so we understood. A person in my group ordered fries and they never came out. Upon waiting over 20 minutes for crab legs, still none. We asked the waitress and she said our order was cancelled due to one of the other couples cancelling something on their order. WHAT?! We were all on separate tabs. What does one person cancelling have to do with the rest of our separate orders? Not only that, she had just cancelled after the fact we had been waiting for 20 minutes. Our waitress began to ignore us once we started asking question and getting upset which only worsened the situation. The food was very tasty but the service, poor communication and attitude from staff made this horrible for us.

sZwIQb2PhxXxrdzm4ayspg.text: I might have singly handed given them more business than any ad they have ever taken out... I discovered this 7 years ago in Vegas and have been there no less than 12 times. (New location by the flamingo) This might be my favorite restaurant west of iowa. The Asian Cajun boils are amazing.... a must!!!

wP7oiz7zMwhjAAd3bU1uCA.text: I've been to one of the Arizona locations and loved it so I'm glad to say the Las Vegas strip restaurant hasn't let down my expectations.  Compared to other seafood boil places, H&J definitely doesn't skimp out on seasonings and portions. Wait time to be seated was only about 20~25 minutes and food came out within 20. Definitely recommend this place if you like your seafood spicy.

ENn5BesJQhXAwrznNaUXGg.text: This place is definitely HYPE. The customer service is subpar and the food is mediocre. The snow crab I ordered was over cooked and the Hot n Juicy sauce that they are supposedly known for was sooo salty. I couldn't even finish the meal. My mom had the fried shrimp and hers was salty as well.   The best thing out of this meal was the sweet potato fries. If you're looking for a good seafood boil in bag, this is not it. Save your money.

5kY4FSTFLVE1-3tpHCDVKw.text: Me and my bf shared the "Getting your feet wet"  special. You get 1lb of crayfish and 1lb of shrimps with sausages, 2 corn, and 2 potatoes.  We got it with their house sauce with the level hot spiciness.  At first it wasn't spicy but the more you eat the spicier it got. I really like the sauce. The crayfish was on the smaller side but that's to be expected since they're not in season. Surprisingly we both were really full.  The food was decently priced and delicious.  Definitely will be returning whenever we're here to visit.

Z9TLa_7gDaAjU0CDtppkHA.text: My husband talked me into coming here for a date night and I was hesitant. I had never had crawfish before and I didn't know what to expect. I'm so glad we came here because it was so tasty! We split the "get your feet wet" which came with 1 lb Crawfish, 1 lb Shrimp, dozen Andouille Sausages,  2  Corns and 2 Potatoes. We ordered it with the hot and juicy seasoning and the baby spice for the spice level. It was absolutely fantastic! The spices were on point and the flavors were awesome! We also split a shrimp po boy which was probably the best po boy I've ever had. I already can't wait to come back!

w0A-tofxJRo-4VhcSt0Vdw.text: Good as usual, but waiter is a bit over described how big their clam is ( it actually really small) recommend just order shrimp green mussels and corns. Other than those are kind of not that worthy.

vU73VC-ek8afWwc_s-6lmg.text: They were out of pretty much everything we wanted to order and we were there around 5PM on a Thursday. No fresh crawfish, no clams, so we resorted to frozen crawfish and green mussels. A bag of crawfish is full of itsy bitsy crawfish. The Juicy Cajun sauce was delicious though. It would definitely raise your blood pressure with how salty it was.  Beers were diluted.

cxaInqFiPAKmmrtYSAfsog.text: Amazing!! Sooo good. Great crawfish and snow crab. Really nice atmosphere too. Come here if you want to have New Orleans food!

y8J_klbjq98_Z9yBHpP2eQ.text: Omgggg so delicious! Tried the mussels, shrimp, crawfish. The shrimp is where it's at. And the hot n juicy seasoning, simply out of this world! They don't go light on the garlic so expect a garlic explosion! But I love garlic so it was perfect for me. Whether it's authentic or not, it was simply delicious!!   They were out of fresh crawfish so we ended up with frozen. Would not recommend it. The meat was almost shriveled from being frozen and the flavor was really not there. Mussels (green) are worth trying however. But for the best bang for the buck, go for the shrimp! Corn is always tasty, the sausage was too salty. Definitely appreciated the add on rice on the side.

DL_TiUKnlV5o-QK9o602TA.text: One of my go to places in Vegas. I've been to the other two locations and they never disappoint.  The Hot & Juicy sauce is the best I've ever had and I've been to a lot of Crab Boils.   This location can accommodate large groups and the food is reasonably priced.   I've ordered the shrimp, sausage, corn and crab in medium sauce.   TIP: THE SAUCE IS HOT BUT GOOD SO ORDER ACCORDINGLY.  If you're sensitive to spicey hot order baby spice.   Overall great place and delicious sauce for your favorite food of choice.

Being Southern, we eat and season with pepper so... can't talk to you all bout that. it's alright.   HOWEVER, to know that the millions of men and women who go to and have gone too and continue to go to combat for this country...  the fact that a MILITARY DISCOUNT is laughed off with a, " I am sorry, no" Just sunk this restaurant for me. See... I stood up for, risked my life for, and survived for US ALL ... watched many who could not return to their loved ones. Let's MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN, by not only words... but actions. V8MvorBuD-ZBLDw8w-IX-w.text: The service here was alright. Originally wanted to eat next door but the wait was way too long and decided to eat here. Hostess welcomed us as we walked in.   Their shrimp here is a big issue. Before you could even peel the head off it disintegrates as you pick it up. There were only a handful of shrimp in my bag that weren't too bad. Majority of the shrimp they served had the texture of soft tofu which meant their shrimp were not fresh one bit. Some even had a slight texture of mashed potato. Not only did I have this issue with my shrimp the other person in my party did as well.   The sauce was quite liquidity. Did not hold much flavor as compared to other seafood boil spots I've been to. It had very few bits of garlic, probably less than half a spoonful in the entire bag. The flavor I ordered was Hot N Juicy, I had an expectation of having all the flavor in one and was quite disappointed.

ZQ5S1hvKHj-WtuVMAySeeg.text: Wow. I seriously can't put into words how good this place is. It's our last night in Vegas and we wanted to have an awesome last supper here. We decided to check out Hot N juicy Crawfish. The menu includes a market price on several different seafood items such as snow crabs, king crab, blue crab, shrimp, crawfish, mussels and many more. We got the shrimp, black mussels, crawfish, fried catfish, sausage and corn. Once items are selected, step 2 is select sauce, we were told the best is to mix all the sauces together, garlic Parmesan, lemon pepper and a buffalo like sauce. Next is spice level. We got hot which was nose running hot but not unbearable. The shrimp (head on) were huge!! Almost prawn like! The mussels excellent, crawfish so big we were amazed (and I've been to NOLA), corn juice, sausage so good. We couldn't pick a better place to get out last Vegas meal. We finished the night with a 1.6lb whole main lobster. It was like having dessert, sooo unbelievably good. Please, please check this place out on your next Vegas trip. I promise you won't be disappointed. We certainly were not!  Couldn't take many photos bc it's quite messy to eat. Gloves and bibs are provided!

5VdQFOgpUpU8S4_C0e7cbQ.text: Disclaimer. I don't eat crawfish.   They have a wide range of alternatives. We got the corn fritters and spicy calamari for apps. The spice level was high but tolerable. The calamari was rubbery and difficult to chew. I wouldn't order that again. The corn fritters taste like they deep fried creamed corn. It was surprising sweet but delicious.    For the entree we got the 1lb snow crabs, shrimp 1lb, sausage, corn. We got the hot n juice at baby spice level. That was perfect for spice us. It was delicious. Honestly if you are sharing with 2 and both love crab legs I'd get the 2lb with 1/2 shrimp. The price was fair. It wasn't cheap but that should be a given with seafood.   Service was prompt. We were seated and eating rather quickly especially for a Sat evening. I'd definitely recommend this place!

4H4SmNmgOM4n_XCfk3Ocmg.text: Appreciate the Asian cajun creole that is finally going around the world. Heard about Hot N Juicy in Los Angeles, CA my brother was raving about it and I was in Las Vegas and decided to try it. I wasn't let down. It isn't the best I have but it definitely will fix my cravings when I am missing home. I got the 'Get your feet wet' combo just to get a little taste since we had other food spots to hit it was enough for my SIL and I. We got the 'Hot N Juicy in medium heat.'

0-MvHfc7nf8lTfLnSED8OQ.text: This is one of the BEST SEAFOOD spots to go to if your craving for that GARLIC BUTTER SHRIMP and other seafood items like Crab legs / Oysters / fried calamari. This particular location is located at Miracle miles shops on Las Vegas Blvd.   Been to this location twice already and we love coming to this location.   FOOD * What we always get when eating at hot and juicy is their *Shrimp 1 pound or more  *Snow Crab Legs  *Cajun Fries  *Corn  *Oysters  *Sausage   As for seasoning  for our shrimp we always get GARLIC BUTTER and for spice level we tried their BABY SPICE / MILD / MEDIUM. If you want SPICY then theirs also SPICY and Extra spicy.   Also don't forget to get a BOWL of RICE.   Restrooms * They have restrooms towards the back of the Resturant one for LADIES and one for MEN.   Shout out to NIKKI JO and his staff for the GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE.

FxUwZaxRFwMfBRR-3bky5A.text: One of my cravings when I last came to Las Vegas, and I'm so glad they now have a site on the Strip. Definitely worth the walk to grab this for a late dinner. (The walk was only 5 minutes from my hotel).  Amazingly on a Saturday night, the place wasn't as packed busy as I feared. It had a nice steady busy pace. Someone greeted us when we got in and said it would be a five minutes wait (there were three of us). It was less than that. We were seated on the second floor.  I ordered rice and shrimps with Hot 'n Juicy sauce, spicy. I shared the "Get Your Feet Wet" meal with another person. You definitely needed your gloves to eat these yummies! I went through three pairs since the shells keep poking holes. There were juices in my gloves each time.  The "Get Your Feet Wet" came with a pound of shrimp, a pound of crayfish, 10? slices of sausages, 2 corns, and 2 potatoes. The sausages were okay. They were sliced diagonally and bite size pieces? Not a fan of the sausages since there were the shrimps and crayfish. Next time I will order the crayfish only. I finished the one pound by myself.  The rice wasn't consistent with the texture. It tasted like someone didn't know how to use the rice cooker and didn't put enough water. There would be some part that is fully cooked and other part where it wasn't fully cooked. It didn't bother me since the juices from the crayfish was so good. I need my rice so I will order again.  Overall, staff were friendly and the food tasted great. Will definitely stop by again before heading home!

TM4UkpJZzrHqmiOOjS6LpQ.text: Hot N Juicy ;-; how I love thee. Why are you not here in Texas? One of the best crawfish place I've been in my lifetime. l1yMUWOZR9Uz0O9O7b2ypQ.text: Always a great time at this spot. Especially at the new location in Vegas. My go to is clams, shrimp, sausage, potatoes, corn, rolls, and a side of drawn butter.   They make seafood enjoyable. Make sure to rock the bib and gloves. Delicious and satisfying.

ZhB1DwJaddfgpApoxcIhgQ.text: I normally never give bad reviews to places based on their service but this place truly has terrible service.   Everything from beginning to end was a rocky ride...   Everything seemed to start off to a good start when our server took our order but after that it just went downhill from there.   First of all, it took FOREVER for our food to come and we had to ask for everything multiple times. Half of our table got their food like 30 minutes later and the other half like 40 minutes later... The worst part about this experience was the fact that my boyfriend and I had to ask 4 different servers, several different times for a cracker for the crab legs. One of our friends had to literally walk downstairs and ask the counter for one. This was just truly ridiculous because not only did I have to wait forever for my food, once I got my food I couldn't even eat it.   My friends also asked for water refills multiple times and we never got anything. Once it was time to pay, we noticed that our server put our cards down on a counter and forgot about it for 15 minutes. She only remembered once we made eye contact with her. What should have been a quick one hour meal turned into a over two hour shit show.   The food was honestly just mediocre.. the shrimp was super hard to peel because the shell was stuck. This usually means they used old shrimp.   Overall, I would steer clear of this place. There are SOO many other places on the strip with delicious food and much better service. Don't waste your time!

dOaTcXB2BSGrFJZTn8jAWQ.text: We went here to check it out and it was good!! Was not the best crab boil I have had but it was not bad. The reason for 3 stars the service was a bit slow and took a while for us to get seated and we were the only ones in line.

enkhBXL29OZbtCX7O1GAsQ.text: Summary: Tasty food, but service for upstairs dining was not great. The etouffee was excellent, but they didn't have the fresh crawfish (only frozen). Expect a little bit of a wait if coming during the evening on a weekend. A fun meal if you don't mind getting your hands dirty.  My wife had been to the Washington DC Hot 'N Juicy earlier this year and had a blast with the food and experience. As a result, when she saw one was located just outside of our Elara abode she said we had to check it out for dinner. We went on a Saturday evening at around 8pm and the restaurant was full up with a wait. After about 10 minutes we were taken upstairs and seated.  Our server gave us a rundown of the menu and indicated that they didn't have any of the fresh crawfish available (what my wife was most excited to have). We perused and decided what we wanted, then waited for her to return to our table upstairs. Throughout the meal we had to usually wait a while to be visited, or even had to flag down other servers if they happened to be in the area since the majority of diners were downstairs. We also had to ask for gloves, silverware, etc instead of them just being offered or provided. Kind of annoying.  We ended up ordering a half pound of snow crab legs, the etouffee, and a pound of shrimp with some potatoes and corn, prepared spicy with the Hot N Juicy seasoning. The food was very good and was enough for the two of us with some leftovers of the etouffee to take back to our room. The price is certainly on the high side for most of the shellfish, but the quality was good and everything tasted good. We managed to stay clean by using the gloves and utensils (which definitely got messy), but the meal was fun and enjoyable overall.

3K89uQ7o-LRYJlC2pB68Xg.text: I've been to many Cajun/creole restaurants and this is by far at the top of the list! The seafood is so fresh and delicious! My man ordered the pound of snow crab legs with a cat fish basket, and I ordered the pound of black mussels. We both got it spicy with the hot n juicy sauce. Everything was perfect! They do have happy hour from 11-4 if you're interested, but only on drinks. Overall the service and food were absolutely delicious!

zWJjUSNHGpli9AroEGC_1Q.text: My first experience at Hot & Juicy Crawfish is one that does not make me want to come back on my next visit to Vegas.  It is not because of the mediocre food, it is because of the absolutely terrible service.  Your options are a couple of different types of sauce with your seafood or crawfish cook/boiled in plastic bags, then served on your plastic covered table and peeling your selections.  Half of the mussels and clams did not open but trying to get a server to discuss it, was next to impossible.  Maybe they were understaffed on that night but two of my colleagues ordered the lobster that took almost forty minutes at a cost of $50 each.  The highlight to me was the side of rice I ordered with some Hot and Juicy sauce on the side.  I don't want to sound cheap but after dropping a fair amount of money, being charges $2.00 for a side of sauce seems insulting.

1B15ROYjGF-AirIQfnFisA.text: If you're craving seafood dunked in flavorful, buttery, spicy, garlicky sauce... this is your place to go! Tentative service from the crew 4.) Prompt food service from kitchen to table 5.) & to top it off, diggin' the slow jams!!!  Thank you for fulfilling my cravings!!!

eg5B7pqJ8qEiy8RoLHjvcw.text: I went to the Hot N Juicy Crawfish on Harmon adjacent to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops for lunch on a Thursday afternoon.  I love "mudbugs" and Hot N Juicy had long been on my Vegas and DC "to do" lists.  They offer a lot more besides crawfish, but I went for what I was craving, a pound of crawfish ($14.95) with Hot N Juicy seasoning.  I believe March is right in the middle of crawfish season, so I was willing to pay a little more for live crawfish vice frozen.  Not being familiar with Hot N Juicy and their definition of spiciness, I played it safe and went with the medium spice level.  I washed it down with my new favorite beer, Joseph James Citra Rye American Pale Ale, which they had on tap.      In truth, crawfish is an acquired taste as it's extremely messy to eat and there's a lot of work for the relatively small payoff of in terms of crawfish tail meat.  It becomes an even smaller payoff if you aren't into sucking the heads.  In short order, I received a plastic bag filled with a pound of whole crawfish bathed in the Hot N Juicy sauce.  The Hot N Juicy sauce was delicious and the medium had plenty of heat (I'll admit it worked up a little sweat on my brow) without overwhelming the delicate flavors of the crawfish meat.  It was good and messy.  Thankfully, they provided a bib.  Like I said, crawfish isn't for everyone, but if you don't mind getting messy (probably not the place to go if you're wearing a suit, or white or light colored clothing), then Hot N Juicy Crawfish is a great choice to get your mudbug fix.

n318fbvfBepEd9rMte7pCA.text: You can't go wrong with a crab boil. And what I liked about Hot N Juicy were the different flavor options. h1ek2jBtd5x9GE1xvNCnyQ.text: So this place advertises fresh crawfish and we called him to ask about their fresh crawfish which they told us on the phone was so amazing. so we decided to walk down the strip to try to find the location which took forever. We finally found the restaurant which is not located on the strip it is on a side street. Luckily our server was very friendly and told us quickly as we sat down that they were out of fresh crawfish and had been for the last week ( we walked 2 miles in 115 degrees to eat fresh crawfish here)but what I want to know is why did the girl on the phone tell me that they had it before we walked all the way down there? luckily our server was very friendly and told us quickly as we sat down that they were out of fresh crawfish and only had frozen, they had been for the last week. The server did offer us a free drink and a sample of the frozen crawfish for our time which was nice but man this was a disappointment I was really looking forward to getting to try this place I guess it wasn't all it was cut out to be

JEUDhshxa1FFD2Ta8msWwA.text: Wow, it was great. Service was nice and attentive,  but the showstopper was the food. The hot and juicy sauce on the shrimp is amazing. I Have decided that every time I go to Vegas, I will eat here.

pl3INSS5GoUrdJRzxkJbBA.text: I passed this place by several times while enjoying my night on the strip and finally decided to stop in. The bartender, who was the best, helped me out when I told her the daiquiri I had with me from another bar was weak  and she added shots of whiskey to it for me. I was happy after that. Unfortunately I didn't try any of the food but plan to go back and check it out.

3uSItfNjyF-nso_dc8aybQ.text: Being an alumni of LSU I had high hopes for this place.  I'm not a fan of heads, legs, tails on shrimp coming out in a kitchen garbage bag.  Food was decent, atmosphere ok, experience and service lacking.  I will say the hubby LOVED his shrimp!

tXbSdnAH3ytUCvlHmD_Q7A.text: Let me tell you... This is my favorite ALL TIME restaurant EVER. I meant to write this weeks ago but I just got home and had time to sit down and relax... It was so nice to have a Hot N Juicy so close to our hotel, my boyfriend and I were in Vegas for about 10 days and went here half the time for our dinners! (And other locations) Our servers, Micha and Miranda, were so attentive to our needs and made sure everything was perfect. The food is hot, delicious, and juicy! And the manager Dan was so pleasant and answered all of our questions the best he could... My boyfriend and I even have places in mind that NEED a Hot N Juicy, and would love to be apart of the franchise. If only they were everywhere!!! Their sauces are phenomenal and can't be replicated... I've never had anything like it anywhere else... It is to DIE FOR. And even if you aren't the biggest fan of hot foods, there is always baby spice! Hands down the best seafood place in the world, and I'm from Alaska (where there's fresh seafood galore.) Love this place!  EDIT: I never do yelp reviews, but this place is SO good I just had to tell everyone about it.

ZpDLeFmA4T1aVoQl8KIR1A.text: This was the BEST CRAWFISH BROIL I'VE EVER HAD!! I'm from the South and I thought to myself... let me see what Vegas calls good crawfish. I had the crawfish, shrimp, andouille sausage, corn and potato with hot and juicy seasoning with spicy heat level. All of these ingredients were seasoned to perfection- flavors were cooked throughout yet not overpowering. ALSO the staff was very attentive and was helpful as I tried to figure out what I wanted to order. I need y'all to expand to the south. Mmm mmm good!

awZBaHSTOJ_N5D3w8WPoJQ.text: This place is fantastic!  Not a crawfish girl so I go for the snow crab.  Lots of seasonings to choose from but I love the Hot N Juicy option.  Be careful....when they say spicy they mean spicy.  They have all varieties of crab, clans, crawfish, lobster....you name it. If you're into shellfish and a messy good time this is the place.  They bring it out in bags and you dump it out and go to town.  One of my Vegas faves!

eQ_QcFUIl3ZBGav4poV9bw.text: I absolutely love this place. It's a must visit whenever I'm in Las Vegas. There are several locations and they all kick ass!! My favorite is the hot and juicy fresh crawfish or shrimp. The frozen crawfish isn't worth it to me. So just get more shrimp if they are out of the fresh crawfish.

FgRnhUaGKxUpAaLd5huGSg.text: Spicyyyyyy! But it was soooo good! I saw this place when I went to Nacho Daddy the day before and I'm glad I went back for this. It's like Boiling Crab but so much better!

WB1HZD0Ibc_ELnYsrLeBrQ.text: I heard so many great things about this place, after trying it out it was mediocre. The service was lousy, and the food was just ok. I wouldn't recommend it. If you've ever been to a real crawfish broil avoid this place. The best thing about this place was the size of the shrimp, but it's like hot without flavor. The waitresses kept forgetting to bring out our drinks, then we received the wrong drinks, forgot our lemons after asking twice. There's too many good restaurants in Vegas to waste money here.

GkvtOY3kZVZvNhrOuNkaIw.text: Ate the king crab legs in baby spice garlic butter. It was so delicious. Obviously a lot of work and mess, but it is very filling. Only issue I had was that baby spice was supposed to be less than mild and I still found it super spicy. But again it was so good!

Xd7lPXBiJUoDOJVIfkruKQ.text: Fun restaurant. Wear something that can take a stain! Lol. They do give you bibs and plastic gloves so that helps. The food was plentiful and some was spicy.

wSGQLiyMr98JfIsq1nqWLQ.text: Shrimp tasted fresh and was good size. Crawfish was slightly smaller than expected. I ordered the Hot&Juicy flavor mild. The spice have a kick but not as spicy so next time I'm going to get med. add sausage, corn and potatoes or like many add a bowl of rice.

Rqcecoqoi5zLWQGTYY9hfw.text: $15/lb shrimp $14/lb crawfish $11 calamari  $0.75/corn  They weren't so busy the night of cinco de mayo so we decided to stop by. I was craving calamari and boy did that hit the spot. They have marinara sauce (thank goodness). I got a half pound of shrimp, lemon pepper, baby spice with a corn added and a side of rice. My boyfriend got a pound of crawfish, hot n juicy, medium with two corns on the side, one plain and one in the sauce.   Their service was great and they always checked up on us. They gave you a bib and gloves once you sit down. They had specials that night, $2 coronas and $5 margaritas which were definitely worth it! I like the location since it's on the strip and open late.  If ever you're near Planet Hollywood and looking for that shrimp or crawfish fix, hot n juicy is the way to go!  They allow outside drinks. *two thumbs up*

bok7q5_w11dpRsu05ABU9A.text: Walking around Vegas there's tons of places that you can eat, non of them interested me very much though. Who wants to eat at over priced chain restaurants!?...I'm so glad we stumbled onto this place and didn't over look it. The foods amazing, place is clean and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Very small and busy place, so make sure to call ahead, don't miss this one though.

mSqNF-ksLuJ6gkhpPtI-Lw.text: I came here on the first week of July, right after a pool party starving being in the sun all day. My friend and I were greeted at the door and the host said that he would have to check with his manager to see if we were allowed in with our swim attire.  My friend had on a full cover up and a cardigan. I myself had on shorts and a cover shirt. I saw a sign that said guests must be covered if wearing swimwear, so I understood his stance. But c'mon dude, you clearly see us dressed. We didn't have any of our "lady parts" hanging out.   Onto the food, we decided to try the "get your feet wet" option since it was our first time trying this place. And I figured this was a good deal since it had 1 lb of crawfish, 1 lb of shrimp, corn, and potatoes! I figured since crawfish was $14/lb and shrimp was $16/lb, I was getting quite a deal for $36. We ordered it with the HOT N JUICY seasoning MEDIUM spice level. We also ordered sweet potato fries ($7) because my friend LOVES to soak them in the seasonings and it that way. I was pretty excited given that it sort of reminds me of Houston with the decor and the way the food came out in plastic bags.   When our food arrived, it was piping hot and smelled amazing! I was ready to dive in and divulge. I went straight for the crawfish. The size was SMALL/MEDIUM mixes, definitely no large sizes. As I pulled apart the tail, I realized the meat either looked overcooked or it was frozen. Pleassseee tell me it's not frozen. PLEASE... IT WAS FROZEN!! I was bamboozled. I felt so betrayed. No where did it say on the menu that it was 1 lb of frozen crawfish, which is only $10/lb and it's something I would never pay for. I have been eating crawfish for over 15 years to know this is FROZEN CRAWFISH. The texture was rubbery, the meat stale, it was a brownish color instead of the opaque pink. The "brains" in the head was not "suckable" at all. I was highly disappointed in this place so far.   Then I went towards the shrimp, which were a pretty big size and they left the head on for you. For those who are shrimp fans like me, I tend to suck on the head too. Since these shrimps were big, I knew the head was juicy. And I wasn't wrong! The shrimp was AMAZING. I absolutely loved it. It wasn't overcooked or soggy, it was perfectly boiled and the seasoning made it 10x better.   Since the crawfish was frozen and never disclosed, I would rate it 1/10. Nothing about the crawfish made me want to finish the rest of it. Since the shrimp was super juicy and sweet, I rate it a 10/10. You can't go wrong with the shrimp in my opinion. The sweet potato fries were standard, nothing special. They were thinly sliced, not thick cut. So this gets a 6/10. The service was a lacking a bit. We ran out of water at one point and kept having to look for our waiter, which is anyone because they sort of help one another out. Then we had to flag down someone for our check. My friend had her credit card ready to go bc we were on a time crunch to head to a show that night. They didn't come get the check from us, so we had to bring it to the cashier area. Service gets a 3/10.   Overall, I would say to order each item by the pound. Don't get the combo deals because you will never know what you'll get. Also, ask for the size of their crawfish before ordering. $14/lb for small is quite unacceptable in my opinion. Ask for a pitcher of water if they provide it because you won't find your server again for a while.

a22eltqJfA48FoV1U3CcQg.text: The sauce is amazing. Now I love spice but baby spice is a good kick. Enjoyed the crowd.. Oh and the but one very one free beer!!! The service was excellent This place is a hidden treasure

eMVX0N6tCD8A13LtYIo7EA.text: Holy effin Batman! This place blows all other crawfish places out of the water - & I'm from San Jose! The sauce is sweet with a bold spicy kick to it. And in the combo we ordered, they had SO MANY sausage slices. HEAVEN! The crawfish and shrimp were fresh and we even had half a dozen oysters to boot. Add a beer plus a shot each and we had a party going! (It's Vegas!) Lol. Our bill came out to about $80 with tip and it was truly money well spent. I'm definitely coming back!

pTMW74eo0K_TThnHW-5ciQ.text: Love this place. Always dependable. Great flavors and good food. Reasonable priced with similar establishments. I have been to this restaurant on and off the strip and have never been disappointed. You can order a number of things in a bag with great flavor combinations. The staff is friendly and very attentive. As I drink for low they were always right there to refill. They checked on us a few times throughout our meal to ensure we were satisfied. The only reason I give it 4/5 is because I've had better. But that isn't a knock to this restaurant. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for seafood on the strip.

tR2vjgGtQPY9CkCfRCccgg.text: Our food here was really good! Our server was missing in action a few times, but was really nice. Hubbs wanted Ginger Ale, but they didn't have any so our server mixed Coke with Sprite...and guess what, it actually tasted very similar to Ginger Ale (minus the ginger). Who knew?    Ok so Hubbs ordered a Shrimp Po' Boy and I ordered catfish with Cajun fries. The server recommended that I have the fish fried crispy and I'm glad that I did. The food was good and really inexpensive. Our food total was $30 and we were full. The shrimp po' boy was a decent size and had plenty of shrimp. The fried catfish was seasoned perfectly and came with a heap of fries.   We had to skip the shelled seafood because having braces and eating shelled crab/crawfish don't mix unfortunately. But several ppl around us really seemed to enjoy it!

4mdrClP-HQD8bvtZBb4ntg.text: So good, we had it twice in the 3 days we were in Vegas! Loving this new location on the strip in Planet Hollywood. We stayed at Aria, and it was a short walk! It's less busy. And service was fast and friendly. There's ample seating and even a second story loft so no wait!  We ordered an assortment of food both visits:  Seafood boils - shrimp, lobster, live crawfish, clams. All seasoned Hot & Juicy, Hot. Perfectly seasoned, garlic-y, and right amount of spice. Seafood was cooked perfectly, tender and sweet. Only complaint is that lobster comes  whole, and you have to work to get the meat.  Fried foods -  cajun fries, cajun calamari, corn fritters - fries and fritter were good, calamari was a bit salty, but not bad.  Mouth is watering just thinking about it again.

osi3xEZyoe5RiNoEk0w1vQ.text: An awesome time.  My lady and I came in unexpected. She's always wanted to try this place, but I've always been trying to avoid it. At least, the one on spring mountain. I just don't like leaving a food place, smelling like the food for the next week or so.  This location, totally different.  We ordered the feast. Crab, crawfish, shrimp, potatoes, corn, and sausages. The works.  We got mild spice and the hot n juicy flavoring.  It also came with Cajun calamari.  Everything was awesome.  Honestly, we could've eaten more. That's how good.  We got to a good level of full.  This meal states it's good for 4 people, but if you haven't eaten all day, I'd say 1-2 people. I probably could've eaten it by myself.  The servers were kind. We sat at the booth near the door, and we had no complaints. It was like our own little spot, away from the loud people on the inside.  Food. Awesome. Service. Great. Five stars all the way.

tHXz_TDrefBO6qQkh_HNBg.text: Food was okay and the service was good. We went on a Sunday, since the other locations were over an hour wait. They sat us down very quickly for a party of 15. We only had two issues. The first one was they brought me a pound of shrimp rather than half. My sister's food was the last to come out. Everyone got their food except her, they told her it was coming out. Ten minutes pass, still no food. We ask the waiter to check on her food. They bring her a bag that wasn't even for her. It was for the table next to us. Obviously, she was angry since she was hungry and everyone else was about to finish. They finally bring her food out. At this point she was very irritated. They could of gave us a discount or a free desert for her since they messed up.

UXFdOH-nJvvJYpAXVr3_FA.text: Amazing food and atmosphere. This is get your hands dirty and enjoy all that this place has to offer type food. Black people will love it! I promise you. Go to this place if you're in town!

zrC1c2peZ_ILepcsIgOZQg.text: This location is definitely the best one!! Tucked away in the corner away from all the craziness and away from Chinatowns traffic and horrible parking. Came to this location today for a friends birthday with a party of 6 was seated right away.   As soon as we sat we were greeted by the friendliest server she introduced herself, her name was Nani & right off the batt she was super friendly and very attentive. She explained the menu to my friends who didn't know how to order because it was there first time. She also made great suggestions to order a half pound of seafood especially if they wanted to try other seafood. Also suggested her favorite items she loved on the menu, which made for a great dinner.   I ordered 1 lb of shrimp hot and juicy mild with rice and a side of corn. Which was the right amount of spice and plenty of food for one person. Calamari was crispy and hot and the black mussels with garlic butter were also great!! Can't wait to be back to enjoy the great food & awesome service.

1p7vNu35cFPw3hx-hm5pNQ.text: Ok Texans going to Vegas you must try ! The seasoning is spectacular and spicy just the kick we like!!!! We have been coming for the past 3 years when we visit Vegas . MxhIqib10Ho60MmEt2PTHw.text: This is a local's place, but just ask the hotel staff and they will give you directions. This place is small and there is nothing pretty about it. It just has great food at reasonable prices. Everything is super good. Beware the heat on the crawfish, but it is tasty and you will love it. You won't be getting silver wear either. Your meal will come to you in a bag and you just grab and enjoy. The service is friendly and great. Have fun.

TLVlsDu-HwIR_8C-M68BLg.text: I loved loved the fact I could try a variety of seafood and that I didn't have to pay for each item individually such as corn potatoes sausage.. This place was very very good and I will be back again when I am in Vegas ! I loved the bib the gloves and the rolls of napkin provided. And the fact the waiter showed me how to eat the crawfish since I had no idea! Such a great place I definitely recommend !

2YeSS9hduaVbnRTY96fasw.text: I'm so glad they opened up this location on the strip (located around the corner of Planet Hollywood, next to Buffalo Wild Wings, and past the walkway bridge) so we don't have to uber, lyft or drive to Spring Mountain Blvd for their other two locations over there.   This is our must go to everytime we visit Las Vegas and we come here atleast 2 times on our trip (1 when we arrive and 1 before we leave). This trip was no exception and since it was so close to our hotel (Planet Hollywood) too bad we didn't stay longer since the only place we ate in our two nights here were 2 other places and Hot N Juicy twice!  Food:  I've been to 3 of their Las Vegas locations now and they all have been consistently the same. The Hot n Juicy sauce is the best i've had out of all the crawdad places like this i've been. The sauce is garlicky, thick enough to stick to the meat and shell but not too thick that it has a goopey texture. The spice levels are on point along with the flavors without it being too oily from the butter.   The Lousiana style was on point as well. No, it's not as thick as the Hot n Juicy but, it still doesn't skip out on the flavor of Lousiana. It's watery but, the juices gets all up inside of the meat and just bathes it in incredible authentic tasting Cajun juice that brings me back to my grandparents days when they made their seafood boil (they're from Lousiana and Georgia).   This time around I got 1lb of crawfish and 1lb of blue crab. This time around the blue crab was really meaty and larger than last time i came at their other 2 location and they still came in a pair only instead of a male and female like my previous experience, this time it came in with 2 males (on both visits this trip). But, we ended up getting a pleasant surprise. Since they were celebrating their anniversary, if you order a lb of blue crab you get a extra blue crab for free.   When we first came here we didn't know that and told the server that we didn't order those crabs and our waitress went back to talk to the person who took our order and came back explaining their deal. Guess what too.. both times the extra crab were female with eggs (YES!).  End food review  The staff are consistently friendly and attentive. The food is quality and the price is perfect. You just can't go wrong with any of the Hot n Juicy locations.   Please open one up in the Bay Area. Thank you :D

wt9U1xDekctXcUi2krn4Tw.text: These are really big back home (DC) so I decided to try this location while vacationing with friends. I ordered a whole Dungeness crab and a half pound of shrimp. The shrimp came first and were perfect. When the crab arrived to the table, it was hot and seasoned. Now here's where the issue comes in. This 1.8 pound crab was completely over cooked. The body of the crab was completely mushy. The legs just made it out as some of them were mushy too. I noticed this after eating a few legs and attempting to eat the body. I could not eat it. It was like hot over cooked crab soup! I informed my waitress of the situation with the crab and she informed me that a manager would come and speak to me. I saw my waitress at least 5 more times before she returned to inform me that her manager who I later learned was named Brittany said that the crab was ok as long as the legs weren't over cooked there was nothing they could do about the body being over cooked and inedible. She stated that her manager said she could take the shrimp I did eat off the bill but not this crab I couldn't eat. I asked my waitress to please have the manager come and say that to me. Frankly it's absurd and I didn't believe a manager in any capacity would say such a thing to a paying customer. (Oh sorry you can only eat half your food, but we definitely expect you to pay in full.) The Manager Brittany tried to actively avoid our table. Once she stopped at our table she stated that she was already aware of the situation and also appeared inebriated. I informed her that what she asked the waitress to tell me in regards to the crab being ok because the legs were cooked was unacceptable. I also informed her that it is very possible to cook a Dungeness crab correctly with the body and the legs cooked properly. Brittany the manger then proceeds to tell me to "chill" cause she was returning from a break and didn't really know what happened? (Not what she said when she finally arrived.) Brittany then proceeds to ask me what my problem is and why I'm being so rude to her. At this point all I have asked is what the solution is to this inedible crab. This woman is rude, aggressive, and just all around has a horrible attitude to be the manager of this establishment. I am beyond angry and offended at the way I've been treated, so much so that before a resolution was offered I excused myself and left the venue and returned to my hotel. I've never been treated so horribly in my life in a restaurant. Brittany who by the way was on another "break" when I left should be nowhere near management. It was almost as if she had no working knowledge of what she was supposed to do or how a manager should behave. The other guests in my party were also taken aback by her level of rudeness and complete lack of even basic customer service skills. I wont ever eat at this location again, and it's a shame because this was my first time ever in one of your restaurants and I'm almost sure I won't be returning based of this experience.

0tfJsPxc4waBAMQpz-HMpw.text: It's another Boiling Crab copy cat except they include Po Boys, and a few other deep fried seafood items that you wouldn't have otherwise found at a Boiling Crab. Truth be told, I don't actually remember the location of this place. I just know that my group and I were walking down the Las Vegas Strip to the Buffalo Wild Wings and upon arriving there and being told that the wait time will be 1 hour and 45 minutes, we were like "Yea....no. Let's go somewhere else."  Hot N Juicy Crawfish just happened to have been right next to the Buffalo Wild Wings. When we got there and asked for the wait time, the waitress said that there was no wait and our group of 5 can immediately go in and sit down, it was no brainer that we ended up eating here.   It's like a medium-sized establishment. The first floor can probably seat something like 30-40 people at any given time. The 2nd floor can probably seat an additional 20 people at any given time and that's ultimately where we ended up at.   Restrooms are on the first floor and in the far right back corner from the entrance. Seemed clean enough and smelled clean enough. Enough said.  Ambiance. This place was literally set up for groups. It was loud. I believe there was music in the background and there were TV's mounted on all sides of the wall but the volume was turned down and tuned into primarily sports channels. Brightly lit, clean, and on the walls hung rather interesting portraits of, I guess, the history of this spot.   Price. It's about the same as a Boiling Crab and all their copy cats. Meaning, roughly in the $15 and up range. I think the highest priced item was the crabs, which was, I think $23 bucks at the time we were there. They go by the market price for the "better seafood items" while the shrimp, crayfish, and I think the green and black mussels were all in the $15-16 for 1 pound range.   Service was consistently good and didn't mess up our order so A+ all around on that front.   I personally ordered a Fried Shrimp Po'Boy, which comes with a side order of fries, 1 pound of black mussels (which I got jipped, btw), and iced water. Frankly, I forgot what sauce options are available for when you order the seafood items but I went with a mild sauce and interesting enough, they allow you to pick the seasoning so I chose Lemon Pepper, if I recall correctly. My friends went with their usual half pound of shrimp, potatoes, crayfish, crabs, sausage, and all at their favorite level of spicy, which was definitely hotter than mine.   If I had to say it, I felt like they could have given more food, given their price tags. The 1 pound of black mussels I got was predominantly empty shells. I think about half of it was empty shells while the other half actually had mussel meat. Even then, the black mussel meat was definitely a lot smaller than what I'm accustomed to. Maybe the black mussels that this restaurant sourced from are just naturally smaller than the one's sold in California? I guess we will never know at this point. The Fried Shrimp Po'Boy was good though. I liked it a lot. It's basically a burger with fried shrimp. Fries was fine. Nothing to write home about on that. It tasted as it should.    All in all, it's A-Ok. Not the best I've had but certainly not the worst either. I've eaten at Boiling Crab (not a fan), Star Crab, which is a copy cat (liked this one a lot better), and this spot and between the three, I still prefer Star Crab. Nevertheless, I'd still recommend giving this place a shot.

ZuNTn6V2Xo-BN4NmHh2PFg.text: Absolutely enjoyed this place! My group & I stayed at the Elara Hotel and decided to walk around and happened upon Hot n Juicy Crawfish which is located on the outside of Planet Hollywood. It was Super Bowl Day and Buffalo Wild Wings were charging $60 to watch the game. So we ended up here instead. Our waitress, Mary, was very sweet & patient with us. We were pretty rowdy due to the game and it was everyone's first time but Mary explained the menu & recommended her favorites;  she recommended the combos which are great for sharing & she also told us that they had a Super Bowl BOGO beer special so you know my group and I constantly had something to chug down with our food. For the ladies of our group Mary recommended the Huckleberry cocktail. So we opted for 2 of the Get Your Feet Wet; 1lb shrimp, 1lb crawfish w/ corn, potatoes & sausages w/ their signature Hot n Juicy sauce. Being first-timers Mary gave everyone a quick tutorial on how to peel a crawfish. Delicious! Everything came in a clear bag and it gets pretty messy but are provided with bibs & gloves. You're also given lemons with salt & pepper to dip your seafood in. And to make our dining experience better the Patriots won! Again, shout out to our waitress Mary for being extremely patient with us especially with us screaming at the TVs. We appreciate you!  We will definitely be back!

W_9ydGVdYRFlzjjHK4KKYw.text: Looking for a fantastic seafood boil while in Vegas? This place is the winner! Seafood you order by the pound and add your choice of sauce and spice level. You can also go with a pre-selected feast that includes corn, sausage, and potatoes. We opted to order by the pound, and got shrimp, crawfish, and blue crab. Sauced it up with garlic butter and mild spice (still definitely some heat with the mild! ). All choices were soooo good. I should also mention that the fried calamari we shared is the best I've had. It was perfect! You're definitely gonna get messy here so they give you bibs and gloves to help keep you from looking like you just swam in a vat of cajun butter, as delicious as THAT sounds. Definitely check out this place, worth every penny!

Rh-VwxAb4A_r22Ns6rSBdQ.text: Very attentive staff and the crawfish boil was one of the best I've had!! I got 3 pounds of crawfish all to myself. They were big, had lots of the yellow stuff (fat) in the head which means the crawlfish are nice and plump! I was surprised at how fresh the crawfish was! Out of the 3 pounds, I only found maybe 3 that tasted past it's prime like gutter/sewer. I got the juicy Cajun seasoning and because some of the fat got boiled out of the crawlfish, it made the seasoning extra juicy! The Cajun seasoning was a bit sweet so if you don't want the sugar then I suggest you just go with the regular old bay style seasoning. I got spice level 3 and wish I got spice level 2 because 3 had some kick to it. I choked a couple times and had to chug water when I accidentally sucked spicy juiced towards the back of my throat.   I think I even got a discount ($12/pound instead of $16) for getting 3 pounds. I got the andouille sausage added to my boil. They were super tasty!!  I also got corn fritters but I don't recommend them...there was more batter than corn. Ranch dressing as a dip was meh.  Service was on point though. They were bringing me everything from gloves to extra lemons and iced teas refills. I'm very pleased for such quality food and service found on the Strip!! Prices were not too outrageous either.  FYI, this location is outside the Miracle Miles shops. It's part of the mall but to get here you must exit the mall!

vCMwx87CSE0AGBxRgbgLpA.text: I am extremely disappointed in this location. It was my first time coming to this location, keep in mind I go to Hot N Juicy once a week but at the three other locations. It really just depends what location I am closest to. We just so happened to be at PH at the time I was craving shrimp!   Let's get back to the point! The lady upfront, her name is Ashley (Team Lead) was the rudest person I've ever encountered at any Hot N Juicy! First off, I understand you are busy and I understand it is very stressful! BUT DO NOT TELL ME OUR TABLE IS READY and have my family & I sit there for another 20-30 mins after already waiting almost an hour! And DO NOT tell me our table is ready when there is no one even cleaning our table. I had to tell 3 different servers why no one was cleaning the table we eventually got seated at! I eventually asked her why no one was cleaning our table & she responded "well can't you see we are busy? We are short staff and our kitchen is backed up. I will get to your table in 10 minutes" WHY WHY WHY tell me our table is ready????!!!!! If you were going to throw in my face that you're short staffed. Finally got a manager and asked her to clean the table because the lady up front told us our table was ready..   I am not one to doubt that they were all probably stressed because of the excessive amount of people there, but that does not give you a right to one give an attitude to your customers. I understand that we were a big party, but we were there before half the people she decided to seat before us! First come first serve right?! We waited over an hour and watched multiple people get seated before us! I am not impressed. I hope one day my opinion will change about this location. KrVAkd3GUD50oEQqtmRHeg.text: By far my favorite place for a taste of savory seafood! To begin, for a party of 2 the wait was a bit longer than anticipated it took around 20-25 minutes. We arrived around 9:45 pm and at that time the place was very much alive and buzzing ( but of course... you're in VEGAS ! ) We sat on the benches along the wall waiting for our table and were given water to compensate for the wait ( how kind :) considering the heat from Vegas ).   TO THE FOOD!!  The two of us shared their "Get Your Feet Wet" a combination of 1/2 lb shrimp,1/2 lb crawfish, 2-3 red potatoes, andouille sausages, corn on the cob, and your choice of sauce/ level of heat.   First, the SHRIMP possibly the best cajun shrimp I have ever had. It's texture was so tender and non-mushy/ powdery unlike some other places I've been to. I'm no seafood fanatic, but the shell from the shrimp could easily be peeled and I know that when it's easy to peel it means its been cooked right!  Second, the CRAWFISH. I don't have much to say on this protein because for me there really isn't much in it already, all in all I have no complaints. Third, the RED POTATOES. Also cooked to my liking. It's firm, round shape was still intact as well as the skin. Not too dense, able to eat in bites and perfect balance for the sauce. Fourth, the ANDOUILLE SAUSAGES. Sliced into decent sizes so it's able to give off a smoky aroma and add flavor.  Fifth, the CORN ON THE COB. Also one of the best cob I've had. I'm not cob person, more of the kernels, but I decided to give it a try and was shocked! As I dug my teeth into it, the sweet juice from the individual kernels and the spicy heat from the cajun sauce immediately floods into my mouth. The sauce is embedded in between each kernel so with every bite you get the full taste of sweet and savory.  Sixth, the SAUCE/ HEAT. Trust the menu and your servers when they say it's Spicy, it reallyyy is SPICY they are NOT lying to you! I believe we chose the staple sauce Hot n Juicy, but for our spicy levels we did Medium in the bag and Hot on the side. The sauce truly compliments the entire the meal, it's not too over powering to the point that you can't taste the seafood, corn etc but it adds a nice kick & twist for your tastebuds.   Additional Tips: - don't wear fancy clothes, and if you do wear multiple bibs ( provided ) - not really for kids unless they just want fish and chips - get ready for some dirty hands and possibly forearms
